The point of which was to educate the public about how to stay safe when venturing outdoors, with the main content player being graphics similar to the one below:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/integrated%20campaigns-1.png\" alt=\"integrated marketing campaigns: REI\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'times new roman', times;\"><a href=\"https://www.outdooralliance.org/blog/2020/5/21/outdoor-alliance-encourages-you-to-recreateresponsibly\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>This graphic was shared on social media to spread awareness of tips to responsibly venture outdoors to avoid health concerns. #<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/explore/tags/recreateresponsibly/\">RecreateResponsibly</a>'s hashtag asks followers to share the tips in real-life situations, shared by<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/rei/\"> REI's Instagram</a>.</p> \n<p>With the hashtag and partnerships, the campaign is also boosted by related blog posts on REI's website. Posts<a href=\"https://www.rei.com/blog/news/social-distancing-when-outdoors\"> like this one</a> offer ways to stay safe while traveling.</p> \n<p>The hashtag has been used by <a href=\"https://twitter.com/NatlParkService/status/1262220214265090048?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet\">The National Park Service</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/COParksWildlife/status/1282693790940225537?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet\">Colorado Parks and Wildlife</a>, and <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Angeles_NF/status/1282736225325969409?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet\">Los Angeles National Forest</a>, and brings awareness to large audiences. The partnerships and REI's content share an educational message and an interactive component — making this campaign diverse and engaging.</p> \n<h3>7. Melt Cosmetics, \"She's in Parties\"</h3> \n<p><strong>Channels: </strong>Website, Instagram, Facebook</p> \n<p>\"She's in Parties\" is the name of an eyeshadow palette from Melt Cosmetics. Says staff writer Rebecca Riserbato, \"The purple palette sparked a hashtag of the same name on Instagram. On the <a href=\"https://www.meltcosmetics.com/products/shes-in-parties-stack\">landing page</a> for the collection, there's a section dedicated to Instagram posts with the hashtag.\"</p> \n<p>The campaign inspired a purple theme, which took over the company's <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/MeltCosmetics\">Facebook</a> and <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/meltcosmetics/\">Instagram</a> accounts. Along with this social media content, influencers who were sent the palette began to upload their reviews on <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IIT5xKwMoYs\">YouTube</a>.</p> \n<iframe style=\"border: none; overflow: hidden; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\" src=\"https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FMeltCosmetics%2Fphotos%2Fa.517812678276981%2F3269799933078228%2F&amp;show_text=true&amp;width=552&amp;height=627&amp;appId\" width=\"552\" height=\"627\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe> \n<p>For this launch, a variety of social tactics were used. A matching social campaign, user-generated hashtag, YouTube recommendations, and a revolving landing page were all contributions to where the campaign was distributed. When you know where your audience spends their time, like the team at Melt, you can reach them with a diverse, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/omni-channel-experience?_ga=2.141127410.110350305.1594674962-940436819.1565181751\">omnichannel</a> strategy.</p> \n<h3>8. Brew Dr. Kombucha, \"Love Wins\"</h3> \n<p><strong>Channels:</strong> Website, Instagram</p> \n<p>\"In May 2020, <a href=\"https://www.brewdrkombucha.com/\">Brew Dr. Kombucha</a> released its signature kombucha with limited-edition colorful, rainbow-wrapping for Pride Month,\" Forsey recalls. \"The wrapping has the lifeline number to <a href=\"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/\">The Trevor Project</a> printed directly on it — the company partnered with The Trevor Project and supports the organization through proceeds of its limited-edition kombucha.\"</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/integrated%20campaigns.png\" alt=\"integrated marketing campaigns: Brew Dr. Kombucha\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'times new roman', times;\"><a href=\"https://www.brewdrkombucha.com/raw-organic-kombucha/love/\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>\"Along with the limited-edition wrapping, the company created a dedicated <a href=\"https://t.sidekickopen79.com/s1t/c/5/f18dQhb0S7lM8dDMPbW2n0x6l2B9nMJN7t5X-FdSD1CN64k8yjQBdbMV1Xcyb5N-pjx103?te=W3R5hFj4cm2zwW4mKLS-3Cf8lZW3HbfVD3_RxJpW3QZgtf43T4P6W3zjCjh49LjRTW3SYFS543T9fZW3F7xLy3ZZps91V3&amp;si=7000000000560688&amp;pi=09f18490-1c40-4985-c598-cbf31cf36894\">landing page</a> for #LoveWins, and supported Pride Month with the #LoveWins hashtag across its social channels.\"</p> \n<p>Forsey continues, \"Ultimately, I chose this campaign as one of my favorite integrated campaigns of 2020 because I was inspired to see this brand uplift and inspire communities while giving proceeds back to an incredibly worthy cause.\"</p> \n<p>The brand chose a social movement that was important to them, Pride, and celebrated it with this integrated campaign. This tactic brings awareness to a social cause, a respected organization, and enhances a celebration.</p> \n<h3>9. The New York Times, \"The Truth Is Hard\"</h3> \n<p><strong>Channels:</strong> Commercial, Facebook, Billboard</p> \n<p>In early 2018, the newspaper <em>The New York Times</em> was struggling. With dwindling subscriptions and dwindling trust in the news from the general public, the team behind the famous publication had to <a href=\"https://droga5.com/work/new-york-times/\">figure out how to build widespread trust</a>.</p> \n<p>That's where \"The Truth Is Hard\" came in — it was a campaign designed to offer transparency. \"I think the best advertising not only gets you to pause and pay attention at the moment but also encourages the viewer to take action and learn more after the fact,\" says Alicia Collins, senior brand manager.</p> \n<p>\"<em>The New York Times'</em> 'The Truth Is Hard' campaign does that. It tells a clear and impactful story, and demonstrates the value and importance of journalism right away.\"</p> \n<p>Following a tribute to journalism at the <a href=\"https://droga5.com/work/new-york-times/\">2018 Oscars</a>, the campaign began. The <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">Times</span> aired a minimalist film to display the clarity of newsprint, and challenged viewers to think about what truth means to them.</p> \n<p>Refugee crises, sickness, and wars —<a href=\"https://droga5.com/work/new-york-times/\"> the second phase</a> dove deep into conveying what journalists endure in order to deliver the most accurate coverage. And, with a <a href=\"https://www.inma.org/blogs/main/post.cfm/new-york-times-truth-is-hard-campaign-touts-journalism-fights-claims-of-fake-news\">paid media campaign</a> on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, all of this content was broadcast for the world to see.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/integrated%20campaigns-2.png\" alt=\"integrated marketing campaigns: The New York Times\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'times new roman', times;\"><a href=\"https://droga5.com/work/new-york-times/\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>This campaign earned the <em>Times</em> their highest number of new subscriptions since the paywall started, <a href=\"https://www.inma.org/blogs/main/post.cfm/new-york-times-truth-is-hard-campaign-touts-journalism-fights-claims-of-fake-news\">increasing signups by 100%</a>. The multiple channels used by the news source to restore their image to the public worked and made this integrated campaign a win.</p> \n<h2>Get Started With Integrated Marketing Campaigns</h2> \n<p>Integrated marketing campaigns can help increase brand awareness, generate leads, and delight your customers. The best integrated marketing campaigns have an omnichannel approach, encourage audience engagement, and hopefully improve your brand reputation.</p> \n<p>And the only way to truly create an integrated marketing campaign is to have a marketing plan template to help you identify the right channels, budget, and strategy for your campaign.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=af934ebe-a3e6-4d2a-b12f-1c7ea40641fb&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Marketing Plan Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/af934ebe-a3e6-4d2a-b12f-1c7ea40641fb.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Four-favorite-integrated-marketing-examples&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 15 Sep 2021 17:30:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/aacfe6c7-71e6-4f49-979f-76099062afa0.png","linkMd5":"20a5217d82c9bac4022a039eb54439e4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn4@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-41-606_5a38291bbbb54ba3.webp","destWidth":433,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5125,"destBytes":6842,"author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/aacfe6c7-71e6-4f49-979f-76099062afa0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn4@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-41-606_5a38291bbbb54ba3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/integrated%20campaigns-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn21@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-47-529_d130188d51d6a1f9.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/integrated%20campaigns-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn98@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-48-200_bd8db3e7dec3a30e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/integrated%20campaigns.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn34@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-47-547_27cb85052e59363b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/integrated%20campaigns-2.png":null,"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/af934ebe-a3e6-4d2a-b12f-1c7ea40641fb.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn6@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-44-989_b69ef96b2d492171.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Four-favorite-integrated-marketing-examples&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn28@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-47-094_d2b206755a677789.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741220},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"How Advertisers are Navigating iOS 14's Mobile Tracking Changes","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-advertisers-are-navigating-ios-14","description":"<p>It's been several months since Apple's iOS 14 update went into effect and the dust has begun to settle. One of the main questions has been,<em> \"How are advertisers handling the mobile tracking changes?\"</em></p> \n<p>Earlier this year, we talked about how this change <em>could</em><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/apple-ios-release-and-privacy-change\"> impact advertisers</a>, but now, we want to follow up. Have any new strategies evolved? What have advertisers been doing to reach their target audiences?</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>In this post, we'll discuss how advertisers have navigated the iOS 14 mobile tracking changes and give you a few tips on how to have continued success with social media and online advertising.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b0f73a5e-16e4-41fd-9511-8564efc560a7&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: State of Marketing in 2021 Report\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b0f73a5e-16e4-41fd-9511-8564efc560a7.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2>Wait, what happened with the iOS 14 update?</h2> \n<p>To summarize, at the beginning of 2021 Apple released a new update that would impact the way that advertisers reach their audience. With the iOS 14 update users needed to opt-in, or give permission, to an app to track their activity outside of the platform.</p> \n<p>So, why were advertisers and marketers concerned? Well, a lot of ad campaigns target audiences based on their behavior online. If an app can't track that information, ads will become less personalized, and in turn, could be less effective.</p> \n<p>The concern for marketers was that they wouldn't be able to deliver their ads to people based on certain activities, like if they'd visited their website, for example. This meant that ads would likely have smaller audience sizes and less accurate reporting.</p> \n<p>Additionally, with this update advertisers are only allowed to use up to eight conversion events from a single website domain. This means if you run a campaign and track several different conversion types (like Lead, Landing Page Views, Purchase) you'll now be capped at eight at any given time.</p> \n<p>Now, you might be wondering, <em>\"What have advertisers been doing?\"</em> Let's discuss it below.</p> \n<h2>How Advertisers are Navigating the iOS 14 Mobile Tracking Changes</h2> \n<p>While the iOS 14 update has made advertisers jump through some more hoops in setting up their ad campaigns (getting domain verification and aggregated event management), the update ultimately hasn't been the death of retargeting or Facebook ads.</p> \n<p>Of course, there have been changes. So far, it looks like <a href=\"https://www.flurry.com/blog/ios-14-5-opt-in-rate-att-restricted-app-tracking-transparency-worldwide-us-daily-latest-update/\">more than 90%</a> of users are opting out of data tracking. This is more than industry experts were predicting.</p> \n<p>So, what have advertisers been doing?</p> \n<h3>1. Diversifying ad spend.</h3> \n<p>The main story of how advertisers are navigating the latest iOS tracking update is diversifying ad spend.</p> \n<p>This means companies have shifted some ad spend that was previously allocated to Facebook to other platforms like Google because of the remarketing features and the ability to target users based on search intent.</p> \n<h3>2. Reporting Facebook success with Google Analytics.</h3> \n<p>While some money is still being used to advertise on Facebook, there are different ways of reporting.</p> \n<p>Companies have begun using UTM parameters on their site's URLs to generate data tracked by Facebook to Google Analytics. This means you can use Google Analytics to track some of the activity on your Facebook ad campaigns.</p> \n<h3>3. Using owned data for lookalike audiences and retargeting.</h3> \n<p>Strategies such as using lookalike audiences or retargeting an email list have continued to drive results. With privacy updates becoming a norm for the big tech companies, marketers will need to begin focusing on owned data to inform their campaigns.</p> \n<p>With your owned data (such as an email list), you can target lookalike audiences <em>or</em> retarget those very people.</p> \n<p>Keep in mind, you can still use the old method of retargeting campaigns because not all of your audience is on iOS devices. You can still use the channel as a cost-effective way to see some <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/return-on-ad-spend\">return on ad spend (ROAS)</a>.</p> \n<h3>4. Using other Facebook advertising options.</h3> \n<p>Besides these new ways of approaching ad campaigns, some advertisers are investing in other ways to reach audiences on Facebook.</p> \n<p>For example, you can use the messaging objective to create a lead-generating chatbot on Facebook Messenger. There are options to retarget users who reach out to you on messenger and start conversations with new leads who click on an ad of yours.</p> \n<p>Additionally, Facebook has another strategy that advertisers have explored: the Facebook lead ads (in-app lead form).</p> \n<p>While using your own landing pages is definitely the preferred method, in a cookieless world, using lead forms on Facebook can help you generate leads and capture first-party data.</p> \n<p>The iOS 14 mobile tracking changes have made Facebook ads less effective, but there are still ways for advertisers to target their audience and generate leads on the platform.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=d976e6fb-0071-4c77-9973-772d11ef72d3&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"state of marketing\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/d976e6fb-0071-4c77-9973-772d11ef72d3.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-advertisers-are-navigating-ios-14&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 27 Sep 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b0f73a5e-16e4-41fd-9511-8564efc560a7.png","linkMd5":"d418d5e22221498a47fcb785524b9eca","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn16@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-284_88b93bfb7be7b212.webp","destWidth":442,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5404,"destBytes":7216,"author":"Rebecca Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b0f73a5e-16e4-41fd-9511-8564efc560a7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn16@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-284_88b93bfb7be7b212.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/d976e6fb-0071-4c77-9973-772d11ef72d3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn53@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-44-178_ba6ee21c8b9c368e.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-advertisers-are-navigating-ios-14&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn98@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-48-659_7bc11e06f9062f97.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741208},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"What is Data as a Service (DaaS)?","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/data-as-a-service","description":"<p><em>\"The Cloud.\"</em></p> \n<p>It's a concept that has grown wildly within the past 20-40 years as technology evolves. But if you're like me, you might not know what it really means.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>The cloud refers to how and where data is stored and where it isn't. It allows software and services to run on the internet, instead of only locally on one device, because the data is stored remotely across a variety of different servers.</p> \n<p>With this technology, companies have begun storing data online and modernizing their infrastructure, data management, storage, and analytics.</p> \n<p>While data management, analytics, and integration can sound like intimidating topics (especially to those of us that aren't mathematically inclined), it's so important for analyzing, strategizing, and increasing reliability in data for your marketing efforts.</p> \n<p>In this post, let's review what data as a service (DaaS) means and look at some DaaS companies to understand it better.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=78dd9e0f-e514-4c88-835a-a8bbff930a4c&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: 2021 State of RevOps [Free Report]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/78dd9e0f-e514-4c88-835a-a8bbff930a4c.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>DaaS companies focus on helping customers use their data in the most strategic, efficient way. Additionally, they help customers store their data and have impeccable search functions to make creating data reports easier.</p> \n<p>As we continue to get more data and insights into what works and doesn't, data-driven decision-making is becoming more and more popular among businesses.</p> \n<p>DaaS is similar to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/saas\">software as a service (SaaS)</a>, which are companies that offer software online and via the cloud, instead of needing to download or install a program. There's also <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/iaas-paas-saas\">IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service) and PaaS (Platform as a Service)</a>.</p> \n<p>Any \"as a service\" company is using the cloud to manage business resources. And while SaaS is a popular term that many people know, not as many people are familiar with DaaS. This is partially because data continues to get more advanced, with more storage capabilities and better analytics as the cloud evolves.</p> \n<p>DaaS companies usually are priced based on the amount of data storage that a business wants to purchase. Data is measured using the megabyte model.</p> \n<p>When businesses have an excess of data and aren't sure how to maintain it, DaaS is a popular solution. By using DaaS software, companies can immediately store and manage their data and will have greater flexibility when it comes to scaling up.</p> \n<p>By now, you might be wondering, <em>\"What are the benefits of using a DaaS platform?\"</em></p> \n<p>Well, one of the main advantages of using a DaaS platform instead of storing data physically on-site is automated maintenance. The DaaS provider will automatically manage data and keep the tools and services up-to-date.</p> \n<p>Additionally, DaaS is more cost-effective and will lead to more agile decision-making and faster innovation. This is because data will be the center of the business and used for strategic decision-making and data management.</p> \n<p>With a data-driven culture, an organization will be able to innovate and grow at high rates because its ideas and initiatives are informed by trustworthy data.</p> \n<p>For example, a company can use a cloud-based DaaS solution to manage compliance and scaling requirements, making it easier to adjust operations to fluctuating demands.</p> \n<p>So, what does this look like in action? And what are some examples of a DaaS company? Let's dive in below.</p> \n<h2>Data as a Service (DaaS) Companies</h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.snowflake.com\">Snowflake</a></h3> \n<p>Snowflake is a DaaS company that provides data warehousing, data lake, data sharing, and data exchange capabilities. This was one of the first modern DaaS companies to provide data as a service products. With this platform, your company can store and analyze both structured and semi-structured data for business insights.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.sap.com/products/hana/cloud.html\">SAP Hana</a></h3> \n<p>SAP Hana is a high-performance in-memory database that provides advanced analytics on multimodel data, on-premise, and in the cloud. With this platform, you can build data solutions with modern architectures and gain business-ready insights in real-time.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/social-data-insight-cloud/csdsr/getting-started-daas.html\">Oracle DaaS</a></h3> \n<p>Oracle DaaS is a subscription-based marketing intelligence platform that leverages Oracle's acquisitions of Datalogix and BlueKai. Oracle DaaS for Marketing provides anonymous multi-channel data for marketers, and Oracle DaaS for Social provides social and enterprise data.</p> \n<p>As technology continues to evolve, managing, storing, and analyzing data will become increasingly important. And while it might seem confusing, DaaS companies can help simplify this process and make it easier to understand.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=0da38821-2804-4d25-a136-7fc424550e22&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/0da38821-2804-4d25-a136-7fc424550e22.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdata-as-a-service&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 15 Sep 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/78dd9e0f-e514-4c88-835a-a8bbff930a4c.png","linkMd5":"b4d88a8d2e4f83fc93fd4bb1b1d4f880","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn27@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-268_fee56ea57e83a38b.webp","destWidth":459,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5771,"destBytes":7582,"author":"Rebecca Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/78dd9e0f-e514-4c88-835a-a8bbff930a4c.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn27@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-268_fee56ea57e83a38b.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/0da38821-2804-4d25-a136-7fc424550e22.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn62@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-49-160_2c5a41873b11ba2d.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdata-as-a-service&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn23@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-45-767_9dc606e28ff40364.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741212},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"What Are Interpersonal Skills? + 5 Ways to Develop Them","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/interpersonal-skills","description":"<p>To succeed at our jobs, we often ended a wide range of skills, from simply communicating to in-depth product knowledge.</p> \n<p>Soft skills, like communication, fall into the category of interpersonal skills, and they are typically expected of everyone, regardless of the position you apply for. In this post, learn what interpersonal skills are, examples of what they look like in action, and how to develop them and display them on your resume to stand out against other applicants.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=4e634041-e1ce-4a85-8e65-aea12fc10b84&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Click here to download leadership lessons from HubSpot founder, Dharmesh  Shah [Free Guide].\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4e634041-e1ce-4a85-8e65-aea12fc10b84.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Interpersonal skills relate to all aspects of life, from close relationships to business partnerships.</p> \n<h3>Interpersonal Skills in Organization</h3> \n<p>In the business world, interpersonal skills dictate how we get along with our team members. For example, suppose you sense tension at work. You may pick up on this and use active listening to get to the root of the problem and then use effective communication to come to a resolution.</p> \n<h4>Why are interpersonal skills important?</h4> \n<p>Many career paths come with consistent interaction with people, whether coworkers or teammates, so it’s crucial to know how to interact with everyone. Without them, it would be challenging to perform as expected.</p> \n<p>Given this, employers look for people with strong interpersonal skills because it means they can work well with others and communicate in a way that drives business success. In some jobs, like customer service, strong interpersonal skills are critical.</p> \n<p>Most critically, interpersonal skills help us interact with others in a respectable manner. Even if you’re a software engineer who spends most of your time on the computer, you still need to interact with your teammates and sometimes explain technical details to those who may not have the same know-how, which requires good communication.</p> \n<p>There tends to be some confusion about interpersonal skills vs intrapersonal skills, so we’ll explain the difference below.</p> \n<h3>Intrapersonal vs. Interpersonal Skills</h3> \n<p>A few letters make up the difference between intrapersonal and interpersonal skills, but they are different. Specifically, interpersonal skills are how you speak to yourself in your mind, and interpersonal skills are involved in conversations with other people.</p> \n<p>However, both relate to each other through emotional intelligence. Having strong self-awareness (intrapersonal) can help you become better with interpersonal skills, as you’ll be able to manage your emotions, regardless of the situation, and respond accordingly. &nbsp;</p> \n<h2>Types of Interpersonal Skills</h2> \n<p>There are various types of interpersonal skills, and many complement each other. Below we’ll list common interpersonal skills and give examples of what they look like in action.</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/communication-skills-sales?_ga=2.105815683.1496526183.1629501918-252241795.1629501918\">Communication</a></strong>&nbsp;— The way you communicate clearly and effectively with others.</li> \n <li><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/conflict-resolution-skills?_ga=2.105815683.1496526183.1629501918-252241795.1629501918\">Conflict management</a></strong>&nbsp;— How you deal with troubling business situations as they arise, whether mediating an issue between colleagues or seeking solutions for a personal matter. Regardless of your level of seniority, conflict management is an essential skill.</li> \n <li><strong>Empathy</strong>&nbsp;— Empathy is the most important interpersonal skill, as you need to have empathy, understanding, and care for those around you and that you work with daily.</li> \n <li><strong>Leadership</strong>&nbsp;— Involves being able to motivate and encourage others, regardless of whether you’re in a leadership role, and being able to step up to the plate in scenarios where a leader is needed.</li> \n <li><strong>Listening</strong>&nbsp;— Strongly relates to communication and empathy; you need to listen to your coworkers, so they feel comfortable, listened to, and valued.</li> \n <li><strong>Collaboration</strong>&nbsp;— As an employee, it is crucial to be able to get along with others and work as a team to get the job done.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Examples of Interpersonal Skills</h3> \n<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; table-layout: fixed; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; border: 1px solid #99acc2; height: 1216.5px;\"> \n <tbody> \n  <tr style=\"height: 125.312px;\"> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 260px; height: 125px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Type of interpersonal skill</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 334px; height: 125px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Example of interpersonal skill in action</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr style=\"height: 209.312px;\"> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 260px; height: 209px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Communication</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 334px; height: 209px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Non-verbal communication and body language, public speaking, verbal communication, written communication, ability to develop rapport</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr style=\"height: 125.312px;\"> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 260px; height: 125px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Conflict management</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 334px; height: 125px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>&nbsp;Problem-solving, active listening, mediating</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr style=\"height: 181.312px;\"> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 260px; height: 181px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Empathy</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 334px; height: 181px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Being caring, compassionate, diplomatic, kind, practicing active listening, being understanding, developing rapport</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr style=\"height: 209.312px;\"> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 260px; height: 209px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Leadership</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 334px; height: 209px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Encouragement, management, mentoring, motivation, dependability, consulting, constructive criticism, diplomacy, flexibility</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr style=\"height: 181.312px;\"> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 260px; height: 181px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Listening</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 334px; height: 181px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Active-listening, curiosity, ability to focus and show that you’re focused, and listening to those who are speaking</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr style=\"height: 181.312px;\"> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 260px; height: 181px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Collaborate</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000; width: 334px; height: 181px;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Ability to see both sides, make people feel respected and valued, work in teams, and understand team dynamics</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n </tbody> \n</table> \n<h2>How to Develop Interpersonal Skills</h2> \n<p>Interpersonal skills are essential, regardless of the role you’re in. Here are some tips for developing your interpersonal skills and improving upon the ones you already have.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">1. Leverage available resources.</p> \n<p>Look for online courses or books from experts that explain the importance of interpersonal skills and give tips on developing them based on their own experiences.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">2. Identify areas for improvement.</p> \n<p>Identifying areas for improvement can help develop your skills.</p> \n<p>You can ask for feedback from people who work with you daily and hear about areas that they think could use improvement. If you work in customer-facing roles, you can monitor your NPS scores or customer feedback surveys to get a sense of where they feel you fall short.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">3. Ask for feedback, and learn from it.</p> \n<p>One of the best ways to get a sense of your skill level is to ask for feedback on your current performance from people that interact with you every day, like colleagues, mentors, or bosses.</p> \n<p>For example, maybe you work in teams on a day-to-day basis, and one of your colleagues says that sometimes they don’t feel heard by you. You can learn from their assessment and make an effort to practice active listening.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">4. Practice your skills.</p> \n<p>As with most skills, one of the best ways to develop them is by practicing them. Put yourself in situations where these skills will be required of you, like stepping up during team meetings and assuming leadership roles. As mentioned above, you can then ask for feedback from peers and learn what went right and what needs more work.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">5. Recognize that there is no “end” to developing your skills.</p> \n<p>Although your desire may be to be perfect, there is no way to be perfect. Everyone is always learning on the go and developing their skills, especially since role requirements can vary.</p> \n<p>For example, working in customer service may require you to focus more on problem-solving and empathy, while assuming a role as a manager may require you to spend more time collaborating and conflict management. Recognize that there is always room for growth and development and, as long as you are aware of this, you’ll develop the skills you need to succeed.</p> \n<h2>Interpersonal Skills on a Resume</h2> \n<p>It’s important to emphasize your interpersonal skills on a resume, as many employers look for them. Sometimes interpersonal skills are referred to as soft skills instead of technical skills like having product knowledge.</p> \n<p>The most important thing to do is to identify the skills you have that match the job description of the new role, so you can explicitly demonstrate how they’ll help you succeed.</p> \n<p>Once you’ve identified these skills, you have three options for displaying them:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>A simple bulleted list of skills,</li> \n <li>A bulleted list of your job accomplishments and the interpersonal skills you have that have helped you achieve this success,</li> \n <li>In a summary of your experience at the top of your resume.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>As mentioned above, there is no finish line for developing your interpersonal skills. Those you need for each job will likely change depending on your industry, and it is always important to continuously be learning. However, leverage the tips on this list, put yourself in situations where you’ll need to practice your skills, and you’ll find yourself succeeding in your roles, regardless of whether you’re just starting out or are a seasoned executive.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=5174aed9-1caa-4a36-b2d6-84c4d96c25fb&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5174aed9-1caa-4a36-b2d6-84c4d96c25fb.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finterpersonal-skills&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 08 Sep 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4e634041-e1ce-4a85-8e65-aea12fc10b84.png","linkMd5":"346c227b49869f31d230def0cdb721f2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn35@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-278_a76d18c90cdcfa92.webp","destWidth":660,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":7430,"destBytes":10618,"author":"fneedle@hubspot.com (Flori Needle)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4e634041-e1ce-4a85-8e65-aea12fc10b84.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn35@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-278_a76d18c90cdcfa92.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5174aed9-1caa-4a36-b2d6-84c4d96c25fb.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn74@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-49-176_5d7cf3090735f322.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finterpersonal-skills&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn81@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-46-925_b53a5d9f7c7b8835.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741265},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"How Google's Head of Startups LATAM Helps Brands Globalize Their Business [+Tips for Marketers]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/google-head-of-startups-on-global-marketing","description":"<p>Nike. McDonald's. Airbnb.</p> \n<p>What do these three brands have in common?</p> \n<p>All three have developed a strong global presence. It's why you hear about the Whopper in Spain, or spot Nike Jordan's on the streets of Indonesia.</p> \n<p>Fortunately, global marketing isn't just for big corporations anymore — nowadays, technology has significantly shrunken the 'cost per entry' when it comes to developing an international brand.</p> \n<p>With social media and search engines closing the information gap between countries, I'm willing to bet some international consumers have already stumbled across your business' website.</p> \n<p>But the question remains: <em>How can you properly market and sell to international audiences? And how can you ensure product-market fit with communities outside your own? </em></p> \n<p>To investigate how startups and small businesses can scale their marketing efforts for a worldwide audience, I sat down with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/andrebarrence/?originalSubdomain=br\">André Barrence</a>, Head of <a href=\"https://startup.google.com/\">Google for Startups</a> LATAM.</p> \n<p>Keep reading to learn Barrence's tips for how startups can effectively sell to international audiences.</p> \n<p>Let's dive in.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=38d93e33-110d-4097-bb9f-3a38329eae3a&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Access Free Resources to Help Your Company Scale\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/38d93e33-110d-4097-bb9f-3a38329eae3a.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">4 Tips for Globalizing Your Marketing Strategy</h2> \n<h3>1. Start with an understanding of your global user.</h3> \n<p>When developing a global brand, you want to start by identifying the most important factor: To <em>whom</em> are you marketing?</p> \n<p>Your user(s) might vary in preferences or lifestyle from country to country, but their challenges — and how your product can meet those challenges — will remain consistent cross-globally.</p> \n<p>In other words, how your product can help a user in the U.S. likely mirrors how your product can help a user in Europe or Asia.</p> \n<p>As Barrence points out, \"What is always a good first solution is to start understanding who your user is, and who your user is <em>everywhere</em>, you know?\"</p> \n<p>Barrence adds, \"I think that startups begin building a product with a specific user in-mind — and startups operate on this idea of serving on a match need, or serving some particular challenge that hasn't been sold yet. And I think the beauty of technology is that you can basically serve the entire world at this point.\"</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/andre%20quote%20on%20how%20to%20globalize%20your%20marketing%20efforts.png?width=1518&amp;name=andre%20quote%20on%20how%20to%20globalize%20your%20marketing%20efforts.png\" alt=\"andre quote on how to globalize your marketing efforts\" width=\"1518\" style=\"width: 1518px;\"></p> \n<p>At this stage, using highly effective analytics tools is key to ensuring you <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/target-audience\">understand your global target persona</a>.</p> \n<p>Additionally, you'll want to use data to determine which region(s) seem most interested in your products or services. This information will help you select a few countries for which you want to create a targeted, localized marketing strategy.</p> \n<h3>2. Figure out which stories appeal to different audiences globally.</h3> \n<p>While your product might serve the same needs across the globe, the stories you tell to highlight your product's key benefits will vary significantly.</p> \n<p>As Barrence puts it, \"Once you've formed a hypothesis on who your user is and why they're searching for your product, you'll want to build a marketing strategy that is locally relevant, because the worst experience is when you're trying to solve for a local need of yours, and for something you're facing in your own country — but the product that you're searching for is built for a different experience entirely.\"</p> \n<p>This is where it's vital to build credibility in local regions.</p> \n<p>Credibility, Barrence adds, is a critical component that is oftentimes forgotten in the hustle of scaling a startup. Startups are often driven by performance — such as traffic, or user acquisition — and building a brand is usually an afterthought.</p> \n<p>This is a mistake, particularly when globalizing your business.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>\"Startups are great at a performance mindset,\" Barrence says, \"but each time you're attempting to reach new markets, you want to make sure you're building a brand, as well.\"</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>Barrence adds, \"Once you test a few ways to position your brand in a local market, you'll want to start developing a more robust strategy for acquiring those users or creating stronger relationships with them.\"</p> \n<h3>3. Pay attention to local flavors when taking your product to the market.</h3> \n<p>There are a few key factors Barrence encourages every startup to take into consideration before expanding into new, international markets.</p> \n<p>First, it's critical your marketing team understands how to position your product in a new regional space.</p> \n<p>As Barrence told me, \"It's very hard for a startup to easily take a position in the [Latin American] market, for instance, because startups in LATAM already understand the user, and they know how to communicate with them and position themselves in the market … So ignoring the local flavors in how you take your product to the market is a big mistake.\"</p> \n<div style=\"\"> \n <img class=\"vidyard-player-embed\" src=\"https://play.vidyard.com/cpGF7jQdhyvY3xfm7jfffc.jpg\" width=\"1200\" height=\"628\" style=\"display: block; max-width: 100%; margin: 0 auto; width: 1200px; height: auto;\" alt=\"andre interview answer\"> \n</div> \n<p>While he acknowledges this doesn't have to be perfect, Barrence does tell me the bare minimum requirements when marketing to new international audiences includes:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Designing a localized version of your product — including language, user interface, and experience.</li> \n <li>Translating your materials into the local language, and using more relevant, local examples or references in your marketing messages.</li> \n <li>Offering support in the local language so users can access help easily when they have questions.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>If you don't have the time or resources to follow the above tips, you might want to reconsider whether it's a good idea to globalize — since without these fundamentals, your users will have a poor user experience and your brand value will suffer.</p> \n<p>Which leads me to my next point …</p> \n<h3>4. Know when globalizing <em>isn't </em>a good idea for your business.</h3> \n<p>There are plenty of startups and small businesses that likely have untapped potential in markets outside of their native countries … but there are still others who should focus their efforts locally, at least for the time being.</p> \n<p>So — how do you know which category your business falls into?</p> \n<p>Ultimately, Barrence says it comes down to whether or not you have a strong foundation. As he puts it, \"One big mistake startups make are scaling prematurely; and the second big mistake is ignoring the signs that you haven't found <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/product-market-fit\">product-market fit</a>.\"</p> \n<p>If you try scaling prematurely, he warns, you risk compromising your existing user's experience and the health of your entire company. So it's better to be cautious here.</p> \n<p>He continues, \"I think testing the waters and making sure you know how to navigate not only the market, but also how to navigate your product and operations <em>within</em> that market, is key.\"</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>Barrence advises, \"Not having enough strong evidence for product-market fit is the potential dark side of globalizing your marketing efforts … [If that's the case], you should focus on building a successful business within your own country first.\"</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>As the world becomes increasingly connected, you'll want to dive deeper into your analytics to determine whether there is already a demand for your product or service outside of the U.S. — and, if there is, how you can address that demand with fresh, localized content or even revamp your marketing messages to ensure they're global-first.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, the decision to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/global-marketing-and-international-business?_ga=2.118001358.692019943.1631738903-259665295.1631738903\">globalize your marketing efforts </a>isn't an easy one, but it could have big pay-offs in the long run. Among other benefits, globalizing your marketing materials expands your consumer-base and provides you with more opportunities to reach — and sell — to more customers.&nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=8f18bb1a-03d7-4fb9-afca-66ac4ccebf6d&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"scaling showcase\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8f18bb1a-03d7-4fb9-afca-66ac4ccebf6d.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fgoogle-head-of-startups-on-global-marketing&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 27 Sep 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/38d93e33-110d-4097-bb9f-3a38329eae3a.png","linkMd5":"04a6a6422d108050b1ed64cdc671e303","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn51@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-42-288_38a6c8c73a912088.webp","destWidth":470,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5393,"destBytes":7366,"author":"Caroline Forsey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/38d93e33-110d-4097-bb9f-3a38329eae3a.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn51@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-42-288_38a6c8c73a912088.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/andre%20quote%20on%20how%20to%20globalize%20your%20marketing%20efforts.png?width=1518&name=andre%20quote%20on%20how%20to%20globalize%20your%20marketing%20efforts.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn15@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-45-843_c5a46ff5b3a4110e.webp","https://play.vidyard.com/cpGF7jQdhyvY3xfm7jfffc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn56@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-48-275_6617db3435b3e687.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8f18bb1a-03d7-4fb9-afca-66ac4ccebf6d.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn12@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-48-049_dcf7aaf8330e44ab.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fgoogle-head-of-startups-on-global-marketing&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn78@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-46-843_ddeec09542db6f77.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741229},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"Hard Skills vs Soft Skills: What's The Difference, and How to Improve Both","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/hard-skills-soft-skills","description":"<p>I first heard about \"hard skills\" and \"soft skills\" in high school.</p> \n<p>Hard skills seemed to be the ones that everyone wanted, and soft skills were just personality traits that were nice to have.</p> \n<p>This worried me, as I saw myself as more of a people person than an academic.</p> \n<p>But, as I transitioned into college and the workplace, I found that soft skills are just as important, if not <em>more</em>&nbsp;important, than hard skills. While technical knowledge can get you a first-round interview, how you interact with others in an interview and in collaborative projects can seal the deal.</p> \n<p>Here, let's dive into the difference between soft and hard skills — plus, how you can include both on your resume to stand out to potential employers.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=4e634041-e1ce-4a85-8e65-aea12fc10b84&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"→ Click here to download leadership lessons from HubSpot founder, Dharmesh  Shah [Free Guide].\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4e634041-e1ce-4a85-8e65-aea12fc10b84.png\"></a></p> \n<h2><strong>Hard Skills vs. Soft Skills</strong></h2> \n<p>According to an article by HubSpot, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/soft-skills\">soft skills</a>&nbsp;are a combination&nbsp;of people skills, social skills, communication skills, emotional intelligence, and personality traits that make it easy to get along and work harmoniously with other people.</p> \n<p>On the other hand, hard skills are specific, technical abilities required to do a job, and are usually acquired through education and experience. It’s helpful to look at these in comparison to each other, especially when building a resume.</p> \n<h2><strong>Hard Skills vs. Soft Skills on a Resume</strong></h2> \n<p>However tempting it may be to mass-distribute your resume when applying for jobs, resumes are not one-size-fits-all. Today’s diverse workplace means that different roles require tailored sets of skills.</p> \n<p>The \"skills\" section is an excellent place for customization because it highlights how well you fit into a role, as well as what makes you unique as a candidate. To figure out which skills to list, start with the job description of the position for which you're applying in the \"desired skills\" or \"requirements\" section. Hunt for keywords a company is looking for, such as \"project management,\" \"fluent in Mandarin,\" or \"proficient in HTML/CSS.\"</p> \n<p>For soft skills in particular, a tip is to look at the company website to get a feel for the culture/tone of the company and find out which qualities are most valued in employees. Specifically, if the company has \"Careers,\" \"Mission,\" or \"About\" sections, these are great places to start.</p> \n<p>As an aspiring HubSpot intern, one scan of the \"Careers\" section of the website led me to notice that the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/careers\">\"HEART\" culture code</a>&nbsp;was featured prominently. I knew it would likely be mentioned in the interview, which is why I listed soft skills like \"empathetic team player\" on my resume.</p> \n<p>Feeling under-qualified for your dream job? Thankfully, both hard skills and soft skills can be improved over time. In addition to traditional methods such as classes and on-the-job training, taking online courses is an accessible way to improve both hard and soft skills. There are also certification courses, such as <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/content-marketing?_ga=2.103615232.1442053283.1629658219-1614773588.1622572836&amp;_gac=1.61409886.1628174368.CjwKCAjwmK6IBhBqEiwAocMc8nmfJ6zC_RpH5vRJBa4W1OOTIBWeqEOVa_o9jf9GCzF59J36NX8oEhoCimYQAvD_BwE\">Content Marketing</a>&nbsp;or <a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/academy/course/6?__hstc=20629287.f531b6964a389a3b70ee1e9e57e5e963.1622572840403.1629904264998.1629909521561.50&amp;__hssc=20629287.3.1629909521561&amp;__hsfp=4043529008\">Google Analytics</a>, that not only provide training but also tangible evidence of skills for employers.</p> \n<p>If you need help identifying and developing your soft skills, a personality or strengths finder tests like <a href=\"https://high5test.com/strengthsfinder-free/\">this one </a>can help.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/hard%20skills%20versus%20soft%20skills.png?width=1200&amp;name=hard%20skills%20versus%20soft%20skills.png\" alt=\"hard skills versus soft skills\" width=\"1200\" style=\"width: 1200px;\"></p> \n<h2><strong>Examples of Soft Skills</strong></h2> \n<h3><strong>Empathy</strong></h3> \n<p>One of the key components of an emotionally intelligent employee/leader is empathy. If you can understand your coworkers and clients, you are better able to collaborate with them and build authentic relationships.</p> \n<p>One way to practice empathy is to be an active listener: Hold space for whatever others are going through and try to understand their perspectives.</p> \n<h3><strong>Communication</strong></h3> \n<p>Going hand in hand with empathy, being able to communicate with people from diverse backgrounds is key in the workplace. In addition, with Slack, email, Zoom calls, and in-person meetings, an effective employee must know how to communicate clearly across various platforms.</p> \n<h3><strong>Adaptability</strong></h3> \n<p>In our ever-changing workplace, having flexibility and a positive attitude toward change is of utmost importance. Make sure to have concrete examples of your adaptability to bring up in a cover letter or interview.</p> \n<p>As someone applying for a remote position at HubSpot, I made sure to highlight my previous remote work experiences. I also discussed my time in both the advertising and automotive industries to showcase my adaptability.</p> \n<h2><strong>Examples of Hard Skills</strong></h2> \n<h3><strong>Bilingual/multilingual ability</strong></h3> \n<p>According to <a href=\"https://fortune.com/2021/08/03/globalization-future-covid-global-500-companies-supply-chains/\">Fortune</a>, globalization in this post-pandemic era is being \"radically transformed.\" As a result, knowing different languages can give you a major advantage in the job market.</p> \n<p>In addition to English, <a href=\"https://blog.rosettastone.com/8-top-languages-to-learn-for-international-business/\">Mandarin, German, and Spanish</a>&nbsp;are the top languages desired for international business. If you haven’t spoken a foreign language since senior year of high school, an app like <a href=\"https://www.duolingo.com/\">DuoLingo</a>&nbsp;is a fun and straightforward way to help you brush up.</p> \n<h3><strong>SEO Marketing</strong></h3> \n<p>For all companies with an online presence, SEO (Search Engine Optimization), plays a huge part in attracting and retaining customers. Resources like <a href=\"https://moz.com/beginners-guide-to-seo#\">The Beginner’s Guide to SEO</a>&nbsp;from Moz (an SEO tools and software company) are a great way to start.</p> \n<h3><strong>Data Analytics</strong></h3> \n<p>Data analytics is the process of obtaining insights from raw data in order to observe trends and draw conclusions. The best method for mastering this skill is through \"learning by doing\" — and the great news is, many of the top data analytics tools are free.</p> \n<p>You can start with trusty old Excel/Google Sheets and learn commands through video tutorials. Programming languages, such as R and Python, are in high demand due to their powerful data analysis capabilities, and both are free and open source.</p> \n<p>And there you have it! Understanding the importance of hard and soft skills is critical to both landing a job and growing in one. Hopefully this post has helped you understand the full differences between the two.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=5f7685cd-6442-4846-afea-a28dcbad007c&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5f7685cd-6442-4846-afea-a28dcbad007c.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhard-skills-soft-skills&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 07 Sep 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4e634041-e1ce-4a85-8e65-aea12fc10b84.png","linkMd5":"f150d102b823cd599be6b95588e7d4dc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn35@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-278_a76d18c90cdcfa92.webp","destWidth":660,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":7430,"destBytes":10618,"author":"Alyssa Yeh","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/4e634041-e1ce-4a85-8e65-aea12fc10b84.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn35@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-278_a76d18c90cdcfa92.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/hard%20skills%20versus%20soft%20skills.png?width=1200&name=hard%20skills%20versus%20soft%20skills.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn57@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-47-106_628e53e3e3285bf4.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5f7685cd-6442-4846-afea-a28dcbad007c.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn38@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-47-520_15a22acbc5258093.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhard-skills-soft-skills&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn66@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-43-956_6538909bc1d919a9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741241},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"When Is the Best Time to Post on Instagram in 2021? [Cheat Sheet]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-best-time-post","description":"<p>To build a sizable Instagram following, you need to create compelling content that your audience actually craves. But if you don't post your content at the right time, most of them will never see it.So how do you figure out the optimal post time for your specific audience? The best way to find an ideal posting time is by testing the timing of your posts to see which post time generates the most audience engagement.</p> \n<p>If you lack the resources or time to conduct your own tests, <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/\">Sprout Social</a>, a social media management platform with over 20,000 customers, has you covered. In 2020, <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/best-times-to-post-on-social-media/#how\">their team analyzed</a> customer data to see what time and day their social media posts generated the most engagement. Here's what they found.</p> \n<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"New Data: Instagram Engagement Report [2021 Version]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png\" align=\"middle\"></a> \n<h2>Global Instagram Engagement</h2> \n<p>If 2020 taught us anything, it's that our worlds are more interconnected than ever before on a global scale. Our social media strategies have to reflect this new way of life in order for our businesses to meet their goals.</p> \n<p>The chart below shows the global engagement on Instagram by the time of day and day of the week. Note: The time is in CDT. That means you wouldn't post at 11 AM for every timezone individually — 11 AM CDT works just fine across posts published for a global audience.</p> \n<p>Need a visual to strategize around? Check out this <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/best-times-to-post-on-social-media/#times-ig\">Sprout Social</a> chart which shows Global Instagram Engagement hotspots.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"Global Instagram Engagement Graph by Sprout Social\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D.png?width=650&amp;name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D.png\" title=\"\" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 650px;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 12px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/best-times-to-post-on-social-media/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<p>Sprout Social went into even more detail about the best times to post on Instagram, including the best times for post engagement. We've summarized the key findings from their report into a quick cheatsheet that you can reference later.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>Best Time to Post to Instagram Cheatsheet</h2> \n<p><img alt=\"Best Time to Post on Instagram Cheat sheet\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-3.png?width=400&amp;name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-3.png\" title=\"\" width=\"400\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 400px;\"></p> \n<p>The day of the week on which you post can change how much engagement you get during that same time.</p> \n<p>Why? Think about the little differences in your daily mood and routine — the ones you might not realize you have — and how they affect your behavior. The same goes for everyone following your Instagram account.</p> \n<p>As much as we don't like to admit it, many of us check our social media first thing in the morning to catch up on the night before. Then, it's time for a lunch break scroll. Finally, we take one last look at what our friends and favorite brands are up to before bed. It makes sense that the heaviest engagement hours align with the way our audiences live their lives.</p> \n<p>Here's another look at the best times to post on Instagram each day as well as some additional insights from<a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/best-times-to-post-on-social-media/#how\"> Sprout Social</a>:</p> \n<h2>Best Time to Post on Instagram Each Day</h2> \n<ul> \n <li>Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, 11 AM - 12 PM CDT - Consider that most of your followers are taking a lunch break around this time and will be more likely to scroll through Instagram to catch up on the latest from their friends, favorite brands, and influencers. During these time periods, share content that is easy to engage with and share.</li> \n <li>Tuesday, 11 AM - 2 PM CDT - Similar to the above, lunch breaks are common around these hours. However, the longer timeframe can be a fitting opportunity to share long-form content like IG TV videos or even go live on Instagram.</li> \n <li>Thursday, 11 AM CDT - For these shorter lunch breaks on Thursdays, try posting Instagram stories with engagement boosters like polls, questions, and quizzes to get quick responses that users will come back to read later on.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>When scheduling posts for Instagram, the same hours may not work for each day. Consider both the day of the week and the industry you're in (we'll talk about the latter in just a minute).</p> \n<p>Pro Tip: Post to Instagram between 7 AM and 10:30 AM CDT from Monday to Friday. You'll get the most consistent engagement that way because your content will have time to pick up views and shares leading into the peak engagement hours around 11 AM CDT.</p> \n<h2>Best Time to Post on Instagram by Industry</h2> \n<p>The general data above about optimal post timing is a great starting point for growing an engaged Instagram audience. But if you want to get more granular, here are the best times to post on Instagram if your organization is in the technology, restaurant, education, healthcare, and non-profit industries, according to Sprout Social's research.</p> \n<h3>Best Times to Post on Instagram for Technology Companies</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"Best time to post on instagram for tech companies\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-2.png?width=650&amp;name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-2.png\" title=\"\" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 650px;\"></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Best Time: Monday 10:00 AM - 10:00 PM CDT</li> \n <li>Most Consistent Engagement: Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM CDT</li> \n <li>Best Day: Monday</li> \n <li>Worst Day: Sunday</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Best Times to Post on Instagram for Restaurants</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"Best time to post on instagram for restaraunts\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-1.png?width=650&amp;name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-1.png\" title=\"\" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 650px;\"></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Best Time: Monday 9 AM - 1 PM</li> \n <li>Most Consistent Engagement: Monday 9 AM - 1 PM</li> \n <li>Best Day: Monday</li> \n <li>Worst Day: Saturday</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Best Times to Post on Instagram for Educational Organizations</h3> \n<img alt=\"Best time to post on instagram for education\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-Sep-10-2021-07-13-32-07-PM.png?width=650&amp;name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-Sep-10-2021-07-13-32-07-PM.png\" title=\"\" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 650px;\"> \n<ul> \n <li>Best Times: Friday 4:00 AM - 5:00 AM, Thursday 2:00 PM CDT</li> \n <li>Most Consistent Engagement: Friday 4:00 AM - 1:00 PM CDT</li> \n <li>Best Day: Friday</li> \n <li>Worst Day: Sunday</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Best Times to Post on Instagram for Healthcare Companies</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"Best time to post on instagram for healthcare\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-4.png?width=650&amp;name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-4.png\" title=\"\" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 650px;\"></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Best Times: Tuesday 8 AM - 12 PM, 5 PM - 8 PM</li> \n <li>Most Consistent Engagement: Sunday, 8:00 AM - 9:00 AM CDT</li> \n <li>Best Day: Monday, Tuesday</li> \n <li>Worst Day: Saturday</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Best Times to Post on Instagram for Nonprofit Organizations</h3> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-Sep-10-2021-07-13-31-83-PM.png?width=650&amp;name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-Sep-10-2021-07-13-31-83-PM.png\" title=\"\" width=\"650\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 650px;\"></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Best Time: Wednesday 10 AM - 6 PM CDT</li> \n <li>Most Consistent Engagement: Monday to Friday from 11:00 AM to 8:00 PM CDT</li> \n <li>Best Day: Wednesday</li> \n <li>Worst Day: Sunday</li> \n</ul> \n<h2>Boost Instagram Engagement on Your Schedule</h2> \n<p>Organic Instagram engagement and a scheduled posting schedule go hand in hand. Each industry has natural peaks and valleys of engagement throughout the day which means your Instagram strategy should flow with them. Use this helpful cheat sheet to plan your social media calendar for next quarter and watch your engagement rate soar.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in February 2021 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\"
