Coleman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn66@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-516_7e54748a32aeb250.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D.png?width=650&name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn37@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-44-059_70337a2167ff91ec.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-3.png?width=400&name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn77@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-45-017_6f5cf2e8f297c83c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-2.png?width=650&name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn80@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-46-468_23cce1e531b38dd4.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-1.png?width=650&name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn58@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-48-992_0fc10f570d8b9212.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-Sep-10-2021-07-13-32-07-PM.png?width=650&name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-Sep-10-2021-07-13-32-07-PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn68@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-45-963_ef838f9ea93bb756.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-4.png?width=650&name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn70@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-45-660_a1b4547e2c7c7091.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-Sep-10-2021-07-13-31-83-PM.png?width=650&name=When%20Is%20the%20Best%20Time%20to%20Post%20on%20Instagram%20in%202021%3F%20%5BCheat%20Sheet%5D-Sep-10-2021-07-13-31-83-PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn24@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-47-914_cb2efd66226b9da3.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn58@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-44-186_a4245cc995397db3.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-best-time-post&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn48@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-44-900_4021a2101eb13c71.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741259},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"What International Marketers Should Know About Instagram Lite","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-lite","description":"<p>Instagram is a top-rated app, with more than <a href=\"https://www.emarketer.com/content/global-instagram-users-2020\">1 billion monthly active users</a>. Within the app, individual users, influencers, brands, and businesses alike share high-quality photo and video content, interact in comments, and exchange direct messages.</p> \n<p>However, as it is a visual-centered platform, some people across the globe have trouble using the app as they don't have the same access to cellular data and internet connection required to load many of the app's features.</p> \n<p>As Instagram wants its platform to be accessible to all, they created a solution: Instagram Lite. Read on to discover what it is, the features it offers, and how it may affect global social media marketing. &nbsp;</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"New Data: Instagram Engagement Report [2021 Version]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2>What is Instagram Lite?</h2> \n<p>Instagram Lite is an <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.instagram.lite&amp;hl=en_US&amp;gl=US\">Android app</a>&nbsp;that is significantly smaller in size (2MB vs. 30-80MB+) than the original Instagram app, so users with differing cellular and internet connection can still benefit from what it has to offer without experiencing a lagging app or differing user experience.</p> \n<p>The goal was to create a more accessible app for emerging markets. Tzach Hadar, Director of Product Management at Facebook Tel Aviv, <a href=\"https://about.fb.com/news/2021/03/bringing-instagram-lite-to-170-countries/\">says</a>&nbsp;“Our teams build these lightweight versions of our apps for people with low connectivity or limited data plans because our basic premise is to leave no one behind.” As such, Instagram Lite still contains many of the valued features within the original app:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Photo and video sharing</li> \n <li>Stories, stickers, and gifs</li> \n <li>Explore page and recommendation algorithms</li> \n <li>Messaging/DMs (groups supported)</li> \n <li>Reels and Reels tab</li> \n <li>Dark mode</li> \n</ul> \n<p>As it is a less-heavy load on devices, features that require significant data or connection have been left out, such as:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Animations when switching between Stories</li> \n <li>Story filters and AR filters</li> \n <li>Swipe-to-type controls</li> \n <li>Going Live</li> \n <li>Shopping and Product tabs</li> \n</ul> \n<p>The app is able to save such significant space on devices by running off of code saved to the cloud rather than on the phone. Kelly Hendrickson, Social Media Marketing Manager at HubSpot, says “What excited me most about Instagram Lite is that it makes the platform more accessible. It requires less space on a phone as well as less data, making it easier to run. This is key in emerging markets.”</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Instagram%20Lite%20q1.png?width=487&amp;name=Instagram%20Lite%20q1.png\" alt=\"benefits of instagram lite\" width=\"487\" style=\"width: 487px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<h3>Where is Instagram Lite available?</h3> \n<p>Instagram Lite is currently available in 170 countries, with India being the largest country of access. Worldwide release is set to happen soon.</p> \n<h3>What is the Instagram Lite UX like?</h3> \n<p>The most significant difference between the Instagram Lite UX is the quality of content on the app, and a lack of graphics and animations that need data to load. While images aren’t grainy or pixelated, they may not be HD in order to ensure that users can load content without experiencing any lagging. A prime example is that when navigating between two different Stories, the animation that is present in the original app is missing.</p> \n<p>Other than that, the Instagram Lite UX is not much different from the original Instagram app. For instance, users have the same profile tab (as shown in the image below) with their profile photo, follower and following count, an image feed, and a Reels tab for those who create them.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram%20lite%20profile%20tab.jpg?width=307&amp;name=instagram%20lite%20profile%20tab.jpg\" alt=\"instagram lite profile tab ux example\" width=\"307\" style=\"width: 307px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://about.fb.com/news/2021/03/bringing-instagram-lite-to-170-countries/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>The home tab, where your Instagram Feed is displayed, is the same as well, with the stories carousel in the top portion of the screen, the heart icon showing likes and interactions, and the messaging arrow button.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/stories%20carousel%20in%20instagram%20lite%20feed.jpg?width=388&amp;name=stories%20carousel%20in%20instagram%20lite%20feed.jpg\" alt=\"instagram lite feed ux example\" width=\"388\" style=\"width: 388px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://about.fb.com/news/2021/03/bringing-instagram-lite-to-170-countries/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>If you want to share a post on Instagram Lite, the post button is in the navigation footer instead of above the Stories carousel.</p> \n<h2>Will Instagram Lite impact global social media marketing?</h2> \n<p>When Instagram Lite becomes available globally, it will require marketers to pivot from typical Instagram marketing strategies. As it currently doesn’t support ads, marketers will have to focus on engagement and building an audience rather than using shoppable tools to drive sales. Hendrickson says, “Part of pulling back features, though, is the removal of advertising. This reminds us how vital Instagram is for brand awareness. When someone can no longer purchase from within the platform, you have the opportunity to influence their decisions down the road by becoming a valuable account for them to follow.”</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram%20lite%20q2.png?width=489&amp;name=instagram%20lite%20q2.png\" alt=\"how instagram lite will affect international marketing\" width=\"489\" style=\"width: 489px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>In addition, marketers will need to be mindful of the quality of photos and videos they upload, as the app is meant to save space and require minimal data usage. Instead, your Instagram Lite strategy may focus on high-quality copy and influencer partnerships in new countries as a means of attracting audience attention, driving engagement, and converting users to paying customers via links to website landing pages.</p> \n<p>Marketers will also need to create content able to be understood by those in different markets and relevant to their interests.</p> \n<p>Before Instagram Lite becomes available in your country, take the time to research emerging markets that already have access to the app, learn more about their interests and pain points, and begin creating a strategy that will help you show them the value you can provide.</p> \n<p>Then, when the app becomes available, you’ll be ready to leverage the information you learned to begin posting on the app.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"instagram statistics\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-lite&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 13 Sep 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png","linkMd5":"56e6bde3dd41df66d2922b7a184b680e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn66@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-516_7e54748a32aeb250.webp","destWidth":500,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5752,"destBytes":7844,"author":"fneedle@hubspot.com (Flori Needle)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn66@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-516_7e54748a32aeb250.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Instagram%20Lite%20q1.png?width=487&name=Instagram%20Lite%20q1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn52@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-44-003_f20e97babb24c4b1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram%20lite%20profile%20tab.jpg?width=307&name=instagram%20lite%20profile%20tab.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn46@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-45-755_e4ab3dba8fdb70b4.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/stories%20carousel%20in%20instagram%20lite%20feed.jpg?width=388&name=stories%20carousel%20in%20instagram%20lite%20feed.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn77@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-48-825_9268a3f4087d1c55.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram%20lite%20q2.png?width=489&name=instagram%20lite%20q2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn70@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-47-698_d48651b65d38daf7.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn58@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-44-186_a4245cc995397db3.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-lite&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741220},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"How One HubSpotter Created a Framework to Reduce Meeting Fatigue","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/meeting-framework-reduce-fatigue","description":"<p><em>This post is a part of Made @ HubSpot, an internal thought leadership series through which we extract lessons from experiments conducted by our very own HubSpotters.</em></p> \n<p>A few months ago, I came to a startling realization: My job is meetings.</p> \n<p>Maybe you can relate. From morning to night, I spend my time jumping from Zoom call to Zoom call. I race to grab a snack in the two minutes I'm afforded in-between calls, and I'm mentally exhausted by the end of the day. It's a struggle to decompress before spending time with friends and family.</p> \n<p>And, equally challenging, the amount of meetings I have takes away from my ability to get my work done.</p> \n<p>I'm Chris Saly — an Engineering Lead at HubSpot.</p> \n<p>As an engineer, my day job was code. Sure, we needed meetings to discuss things and stay updated as a team, but the main mechanism and value of my job was the quality and reliability of the code I produced.</p> \n<p>Now, the primary value of my job is talking to others. Whether it's as a mentor, being involved in tactical decisions, or helping set a strategic vision, most of these goals are communicated through meetings.</p> \n<p>However, there are some very real consequences to my role as an EL. Among other things, my meeting-heavy life was taking its toll on my mental health, relationships, and workplace productivity.</p> \n<p>I knew something had to change. Here, I'll show you how I incorporated a framework into my calendar planning to reduce meetings, and take back control of my time.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=5d5a32a5-6232-4c92-8e70-1bc1a712a6af&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Meeting Agenda Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5d5a32a5-6232-4c92-8e70-1bc1a712a6af.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2><strong>My Job is Meetings</strong></h2> \n<p>As an engineering lead, I manage the 12 engineers in my group and provide a strategic vision for the pillar in collaboration with my project management, business system analysts, and design peers.</p> \n<p>We build internal tools and systems that support the HubSpot Sales, Success, Support, Marketing, and Operations teams to do their jobs day-to-day.</p> \n<p>As a result, in additional to the typical duties of an EL at HubSpot, there is also a healthy dose of stakeholder management thrown in, as well.</p> \n<p>The nature of my role means that meetings cover a wide range of topics. I might go from one meeting talking about the three year vision for HubSpot's Sales team, to a systems design discussion on something we're building right now, to a mentoring conversation with a Tech Lead and then into a critsit retrospective.</p> \n<p>What I've realized is that my job is now meetings.</p> \n<h3>What prompted this?</h3> \n<p>I noticed a a number of days over the last several months where despite finishing work at 5 or 6, closing the laptop and entirely disconnecting from work, I was still amped up and my brain was in 'work mode' at 9 PM.</p> \n<p>I was struggling to decompress. And considering <a href=\"https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2021/04/15/2210768/0/en/Nearly-Half-of-Professionals-Experience-Zoom-Fatigue-and-Burnout-from-Online-Meetings.html\">nearly half of professionals report a high degree of exhaustion</a> after numerous daily video calls, I'm willing to bet most of you understand this frustration.</p> \n<p>My calendar on Oct 28th last year is a fair example of what a typical day would look like before Christmas:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Start my day with a 1-1 with a Tech Lead to discuss mentorship and team health.</li> \n <li>Followed by a conversation across multiple product groups on the technical feasibility of a specific suggestion for a 2021 compass item.</li> \n <li>Then a kickoff meeting for our pillar that is partially selling the vision and partially a social chat.</li> \n <li>After a quick break we're onto an in-depth technical overview of a system we need to start using as engineers.</li> \n <li>Capping off the day with a meeting with ELs+Director in Flywheel that, depending on the day, might cover people management, technical visioning, or our groups strategy.</li> \n</ul> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/My%20job%20is%20meetings.png?width=528&amp;height=601&amp;name=My%20job%20is%20meetings.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"528\" height=\"601\"></p> \n<h3>So … What's The Problem?</h3> \n<p>While I was feeling overwhelmed, I didn't really understand <em>why</em>, so I took a couple of steps to figure out where things were going wrong.</p> \n<p>First, I made a table of all of my meetings, categorized by their purpose, and calculated the amount of time I spent on them on a weekly basis (see below for more details on this)</p> \n<p>I also did some soul-searching to see how I was feeling about my meetings. Whether there were days I dreaded, or days I really enjoyed, and tried to get in touch with why I felt that way.</p> \n<p>This gave me a couple of realizations. First, I realized the ratio of time spent on supporting teams that report to me, working with peers, and staying abreast of things happening in the company felt right to me.</p> \n<p>However, the sheer volume of meetings had crept up on me. Over the course of the previous six months, my group had <em>doubled</em>&nbsp;in size and meetings had passed a threshold without me noticing.</p> \n<p>I also realized my meeting load on a weekly basis varied depending on when all my recurring meetings happened to fall.</p> \n<p>And, perhaps most challenging of all, I realized there were no themes or focus to my meeting days. One meeting might be deep in the weeds, and the next would be a 30,000 foot view. Changing contexts throughout the day like that is hard, and takes unnecessary mental energy.</p> \n<p>Plus, as I'm sure most can relate, the pandemic made my life outside of work Zoom-heavy, as well, with remote birthdays and happy hours. All of which is to say: I was tired of all the screen time.</p> \n<p>When I thought about how this all affected me, I came up with the following list:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>I sometimes end the day not being able to turn of my brain and spend time with family &amp; friends.</li> \n <li>It's a mentally taxing thing to change contexts all day long time and it has an outsized effect on how much energy I have for myself at the end of the day.</li> \n <li>I often feel like I'm running in place trying to take notes, digest information, grab a snack, and use the bathroom as I go from one meeting to the next.</li> \n <li>I struggle to make time for things like AMAs, All Hands, Science Fair, Tech Talk &amp; Hub Talks. After Christmas I had a 12 week tech talk backlog because I just didn't have the time or capacity to watch them.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>If this list resonates with you, don't despair and keep reading. Fortunately, I came up with a solution to my meetings-heavy job.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">A New Framework for Meetings</h2> \n<p>If my job is meetings, I needed a <em>framework</em>&nbsp;for those meetings to live in — which included boundaries and rules to keep my sanity, as the old ad-hoc approach clearly wasn't cutting it any more.</p> \n<p>First, here are the <span style=\"font-weight: normal;\">boundaries I set in regards to my mental health</span>:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>No more than 90 minutes of meetings in one go:</strong>&nbsp;There's only so long I can pay attention and go without a bathroom break.</li> \n <li><strong>Scheduled 15/30 minute breaks before and after any 60 minute block:</strong>&nbsp;I book these in as 'meeting gap' meetings on my calendar to stop people booking over them.</li> \n <li><strong>No more than 2.5 hours of meetings in the periods before or after lunch:</strong>&nbsp;If I go beyond this I can't decompress in the evenings.</li> \n <li><strong>Hard stop of meetings at 5 PM:</strong>&nbsp;I need at least 15 mins to wrap up my thoughts for the day, send a few slacks and take notes for tomorrow. Trying to send a message at 6pm when hangry isn't a good idea.</li> \n <li><strong>Friday has no meetings, and certainly no meetings after 3 PM on Friday:</strong>&nbsp;I use Friday as a catchup and focus day so keeping it free of meetings is key to that. I also need time to wind down from the week and if I'm leaving stuff undone it really affects my weekend</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Obviously, these aren't set in stone, and I'm willing to make exceptions to these if there is a genuine need e.g. If there's a critsit or a big business impact.</p> \n<p>But for regular day-to-day meetings, I've found there are very few meetings that can't wait a couple of days. I've also realized meetings rarely need to be more than 90 minutes.</p> \n<p>If I need exceptions to these boundaries more than once or twice a month, my spidey sense starts tingling.</p> \n<p>Once I set those mental health boundaries, I took it a step further by creating a table to organize my meetings and discover patterns.</p> \n<p>First, I put all my meetings into a spreadsheet, tagged each with some relevant tags, and used that as my basis for both analyzing and changing my meeting schedule. It allowed me to play with meeting cadences, and see how it would affect the overall picture.</p> \n<p>It also gave me a some data I could analyze to answer the following questions:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>How much time was I spending with teams in my pillar versus my peers and the pillar structure versus the larger Revenue Product Group?</li> \n <li>How much time on broader company alignment like tech talk, AMA, science fair, company talks, etc?</li> \n <li>Was I over-indexing on supporting any particular group and did the overall balance feel right?</li> \n <li>Were there any low priority meetings that were too frequent?</li> \n <li>Was the meeting volume per week roughly the same? And is that what I wanted?</li> \n</ul> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/My%20job%20is%20meetings-1.png?width=624&amp;height=316&amp;name=My%20job%20is%20meetings-1.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\" height=\"316\"></p> \n<p>Let's dive into some of the features of this table now.</p> \n<h3>1. Color Coding</h3> \n<p>I've been color coding my calendar for over a year now and it's been really useful, but it's been ad hoc and I often forget or change what the colors mean without thinking about it. This time I wrote it down to keep myself honest, and so I can refer back to it if I need to.</p> \n<p>Color coding my calendar makes it easy to see at a glance what my day and week looks like. If there are too many yellows or reds (meaning medium or high priority) on my calendar I know I need to reschedule or skip some meetings. If I have a day that looks like a rainbow, that probably means I'll be changing contexts all the time and should try to move things. If I have a solid block of color with no grey in it, I have no 'me time' and will be fried by the end of the day. Any of these things are enough to get my spidey senses tingly.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://support.google.com/a/users/answer/9323423?hl=en\">Here's how to change colors in Google calendar</a>.</p> \n<h3>2. Meeting Frequency</h3> \n<p>My meetings had a jumble of recurrences that had grown organically and could be on any schedule, which led to a pretty messy and inconsistent calendar. To help make things clearer and more regular I've categorized them into buckets with default recurrences:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Weekly</strong>: High value, high impact. Things that require regular and high volume communication e.g. Direct reports/mentorship, an active project that is close to going live.</li> \n <li><strong>Twice a Month</strong>: Things that require ongoing close alignment e.g. same level peers and high stakes projects.</li> \n <li><strong>Monthly</strong>: Important topics that don't change all that rapidly e.g. skip-level 1-1s, project updates.</li> \n <li><strong>Every two months</strong>: Just keeping in touch e.g social and connection keeping, interesting projects but doesn't need active involvement.</li> \n <li><strong>Quarterly</strong>: Alignment and planning e.g. product group meetings, OKRs, etc.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Using this rubric has a few benefits:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>It made me think about the purpose of meetings and decide what the appropriate cadence is</li> \n <li>It gave me a common benchmark to compare meetings so I have comparably valuable meetings on similar cadences</li> \n <li>With most meetings now happening once or twice a month, I can often pair similar meetings on the same day which means less context switching.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>3. 'Week in Month' Meetings</h3> \n<p>Before I started this my recurring meetings were generally on an 'every X week' basis — as in all of my meetings recurred every 2, 3, 4 weeks.</p> \n<p>The change I've made here is to move all meetings to a 'week in month' basis. This means that instead of meeting with someone every four weeks, I'll meet with them every 3rd Thursday, or instead of every two weeks, it's every 2nd and 4th Tuesday.</p> \n<p>This approach has a number of benefits:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>It combines with 'meeting frequency' above to allow me to theme days and weeks so I'm not changing contexts all the time</li> \n <li>It gives a certain cadence to the month e.g. it's the middle of the month so I know I'm talking to team X this week</li> \n <li>There are 12 months in the year but 13 blocks of 4 weeks, so it inherently slightly decreases the number of meetings</li> \n <li>It frees up the 29th, 30th &amp; 31st as mostly meeting-free days</li> \n <li>Aspects of our business and lives often run on a monthly cadence and tying meetings to that same cadence can be a really useful tool. (Examples of this might include Irish public Holidays, which typically fall on the first Friday of the month and people often take the Thursday or Monday to make it a long weekend; performance reviews and ACR often happen at the beginning of the month; and sales have end-of-month targets, which leads to more pressure on the systems in the last few days of the month.)</li> \n</ul> \n<p>All of this color coordination and categorization is well and good — but I'm betting you're thinking, <em>Well … did it work? </em></p> \n<p>Let's dive into results now.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">So ... Is It Working?</h2> \n<p>I've been making these changes since the beginning of the year and I've had great results so far.</p> \n<p>My mental health has improved and I have more time and energy for myself each day after work. I've drastically decreased the amount of days that I struggle to decompress when the work day is done.</p> \n<p>I've caught up on all the tech talks and I'm following up on action items from meetings more reliably and quickly. I also have more time to get non-meeting work done, and generally feel much more productive.</p> \n<p><strong>This was a fairly typical way for my calendar to look before:</strong></p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/My%20job%20is%20meetings-3.png?width=624&amp;name=My%20job%20is%20meetings-3.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\"></p> \n<p><strong>And this is a typical week now:</strong></p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/My%20job%20is%20meetings-2.png?width=624&amp;height=280&amp;name=My%20job%20is%20meetings-2.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\" height=\"280\"></p> \n<p>Ultimately, what worked for me might not work for you.</p> \n<p>But I encourage anyone who feels overwhelmed by their schedule to take the time to proactively assess and diagnose for redundancies, wasted time, or time that could be better spent re-charging. Simply taking the time to analyze my calendar enabled me to create a more efficient schedule that worked for <em>me. </em></p> \n<p>So maybe that's really the lesson here: Figure out how your job can work for you, not the other way around. Each person is unique with specific preferences, and if you don't fight for your calendar to look the way you need it to … who will? &nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=fc7ec4be-ccae-4854-ac92-35e53f69a4b5&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"meeting agenda template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/fc7ec4be-ccae-4854-ac92-35e53f69a4b5.png\"></a></p>  \n<img Saly","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5d5a32a5-6232-4c92-8e70-1bc1a712a6af.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn3@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-510_e04dc189aa5955e5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/My%20job%20is%20meetings.png?width=528&height=601&name=My%20job%20is%20meetings.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn80@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-45-998_2ecb17d0cd19b9aa.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/My%20job%20is%20meetings-1.png?width=624&height=316&name=My%20job%20is%20meetings-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn70@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-44-094_e09bd3469bd1f625.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/My%20job%20is%20meetings-3.png?width=624&name=My%20job%20is%20meetings-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn10@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-47-796_2ac6d4c36054cef2.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/My%20job%20is%20meetings-2.png?width=624&height=280&name=My%20job%20is%20meetings-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn73@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-45-213_65ac7db48e2703e7.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/fc7ec4be-ccae-4854-ac92-35e53f69a4b5.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn5@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-48-748_81c87ea5bdd83d60.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmeeting-framework-reduce-fatigue&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn70@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-44-916_2015a698fda7e219.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741237},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"11 of the Best A/B Testing Tools for 2020","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/a-b-testing-tools","description":"<p>In the marketing industry, we treat experts like they’re village elders, soaking up every tip and trick they have to offer so we can implement them into our own work, desperately hoping for similar results.</p> \n<p>But, when you really think about it, marketing is always changing and experts often don’t have visibility into your unique context.</p> \n<p>This naturally begs the question: what should you do when you can’t find a solution to one of your problems on the internet? To find the answers to your unique problem, consider channeling your inner Sherlock Holmes and become an investigator.</p> \n<p>Investigators forage for information that’ll lead them to the answers to their own specific questions. And, as a marketer, one of the best investigative tools at your disposal is A/B testing.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=5d42eade-1de3-4ff1-adba-6b1521e6cbde&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Free Download: A/B Testing Guide and Kit\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5d42eade-1de3-4ff1-adba-6b1521e6cbde.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>Every company has a different set of customers, so there’s no one-size-fits-all formula for designing the most optimal website, crafting the most compelling copy, or building the most effective product.</p> \n<p>To figure out which website design, line of copy, or product feature will produce the best results for your company, you must discover what your unique set of customers prefer.</p> \n<p>To help you do this, we’ve curated eight of the best A/B testing tools that’ll help you optimize your website design, copy, product, and, most importantly, help you find the answers tailored to your needs</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ab-testing-kit?hubs_post-cta=body&amp;_ga=2.268476913.1667640274.1563800435-1307414301.1541080541\">HubSpot &amp; Kissmetrics' A/B Testing Kit</a> [Featured Tool]</h4> \n<p>Don't know where to start with A/B testing? This tool may be just what you need.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ab-testing-tool-hubspot.png?width=284&amp;name=ab-testing-tool-hubspot.png\" alt=\"a/b testing tool from HubSpot\" width=\"284\" style=\"width: 284px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ab-testing-kit?hubs_post-cta=body\">Download the kit for free to get started with A/B testing in your business</a> – an A/B test tracking template, a how-to guide for instruction and inspiration, and a statistical significance calculator to see if your tests were wins, losses, or inconclusive.</p> \n<p>It's ideal for businesses just getting started with A/B testing, or for businesses that need a way to track their existing tests.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing: </strong><span style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Free</span></p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://marketingplatform.google.com/about/optimize/features/\">Google Optimize</a></h4> \n<p>Google Optimize offers a set of tools under the Google Marketing Platform to help brands improve their website's performance.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-google-optimize.jpg?width=550&amp;name=a_b-testing-tool-google-optimize.jpg\" alt=\"a/b testing-tool: Google Optimize\" width=\"550\" style=\"width: 550px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://marketingplatform.google.com/about/optimize/features/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Their A/B testing tool, in particular, offers more than just the standard A/B testing. Users can test more than two versions and can also run:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Multivariate testing</li> \n <li>Split URL testing</li> \n <li>Server-side experiments</li> \n</ul> \n<p>The best part? It's free to use for all your testing and personalization needs.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing: </strong><span style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Free</span></p> \n<h3>Landing Page A/B Testing Tools</h3> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.freshworks.com/marketing-automation/conversion-rate-optimization/ab-testing/\">Freshmarketer</a></h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-freshmarketer.jpg?width=550&amp;name=a_b-testing-tool-freshmarketer.jpg\" alt=\"a/b testing tool freshmarketer\" width=\"550\" style=\"width: 550px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.freshworks.com/crm/features/ab-testing/\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>Freshmarketer, which is the marketing arm of the business platform <a href=\"https://www.freshworks.com/\">Freshworks</a>, is a conversion rate optimization software that offers A/B testing and split URL testing.</p> \n<p>Their A/B testing tool can test, target, and validate your experiment, integrate with Google Analytics, and even track the amount of revenue your experiments have generated.</p> \n<p>Freshmarketer’s Split URL testing tool can help you test multiple variations of URLs, turn winning test variations into real web pages, and grasp the effectiveness of your web design by offering heatmaps of every variation of your split URL test.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing: </strong><span style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Starts at $19/month for A/B testing features</span></p> \n<h3>Web Testing Tools</h3> \n<h4>4. <a href=\"https://vwo.com/\">VWO</a><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/pasted%20image%200-26.png?width=500&amp;name=pasted%20image%200-26.png\" alt=\"a/b testing tools - vmo\" width=\"500\" style=\"width: 500px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"></h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://vwo.com/features/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Trusted by over 4,500 enterprise brands including eBay, Target, and Virgin Holidays, VWO is an A/B testing and conversion rate optimization platform tailored specifically for enterprise brands.</p> \n<p>In their suite, you can build A/B tests, Split URL tests, and multivariate tests with a drop-and-drop editor.</p> \n<p>To gauge the performance of your tests, VWO offers a robust reporting dashboard. VWO also offers a SmartStats feature that leverages Bayesian statistics to help you run faster tests, give you more control of your tests, and reach more accurate conclusions.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing:</strong> Upon request</p> \n<h4>5. <a href=\"https://www.optimizely.com/\">Optimizely</a></h4> \n<p>With <a href=\"https://www.optimizely.com/\">24 Fortune 100 companies as customers</a>, Optimizely is a digital experimentation platform for enterprise marketing, product, and engineering teams.</p> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/optimizely-testing.gif?width=550&amp;name=optimizely-testing.gif\" alt=\"optimizely testing example\" width=\"550\" style=\"width: 550px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://help.optimizely.com/Build_Campaigns_and_Experiments/Multivariate_tests_for_Optimizely_X\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>Using their powerful A/B and multi-page experimentation tool, you can run multiple experiments on one page at the same time, allowing you to test various variables of your web design.</p> \n<p>Optimizely also offers testing on dynamic websites, various experiment dimensions like an ad campaign, geography, and cookies, and various experiment segmentation parameters like device, browser, and campaign.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing:</strong> Upon request</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://www.omniconvert.com/\">Omniconvert</a></h3> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-omniconvert.jpg?width=2580&amp;name=a_b-testing-tool-omniconvert.jpg\" alt=\"a/b testing tool omniconvert\" width=\"2580\" style=\"width: 2580px;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.omniconvert.com/\">Image Source</a></span></span></p> \n<p>It's a conversion rate optimization platform that offers an A/B testing tool, as well as survey, personalization, overlay, and segmentation tools.</p> \n<p>Using their A/B testing tool, you can run A/B tests on desktop, mobile, and tablet. Additionally, you can turn winning versions of an A/B test into the control for a future test and leverage Frequentist or Bayesian statistics to validate your tests.</p> \n<p>Omniconvert also blends their segmentation tool with their A/B testing tool to let you test over 40 segmentation parameters, like:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Geolocation</li> \n <li>Traffic source</li> \n <li>Visitor behavior</li> \n</ul> \n<p>This allows you to improve your website’s user experience, product features, and content’s ability to engage and convert.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing: </strong>Starts at $167/month</p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.crazyegg.com/\">Crazy Egg</a></h3> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/pasted%20image%200%20(1)-10.png?width=500&amp;name=pasted%20image%200%20(1)-10.png\" title=\"\" width=\"500\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 500px;\" alt=\"a/b testing tool  - crazy egg\"> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.crazyegg.com/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Crazy Egg is a website optimization software that offers A/B testing, heat mapping, and usability testing tools.</p> \n<p>Its A/B testing tool lets you test variations of every single page on your website by adding one snippet of code to the pages you want to experiment on.</p> \n<p>Crazy Egg also lets you build A/B tests without any coding experience, sends more traffic to the optimal variant of your test once it recognizes it’s the winner, and offers intuitive conversion tracking and reporting tools.</p> \n<p>If you work for a small business, Crazy Egg is definitely a tool you should consider.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing: </strong>Starts at $24/month</p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://www.abtasty.com/\">AB Tasty</a></h3> \n<p>With AB Tasty's conversion rate optimization software, your team can build and run A/B tests, split tests, multivariate tests, and funnel tests with their visual editor.</p> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/pasted%20image%200%20(2)-7.png\" title=\"\" width=\"100%\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"a/b testing tool  - ab tasty\"> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.abtasty.com/ab-testing-solution/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>You can also leverage their advanced targeting to test based on various criteria like URL, geolocation, weather, and more.</p> \n<p>To help validate your tests, AB tasty offers reports that display your tests and their confidence levels in real-time. This allows you to make decisions quickly and accurately.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing: </strong>Upon request</p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://www.convert.com/\">Convert</a></h3> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/pasted%20image%200%20(3)-6.png\" title=\"\" width=\"100%\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"a/b testing tool - convert\"> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.convert.com/features/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Trusted by brands like Sony, Unicef, and Jabra, Convert is an A/B testing and web personalization software that offers A/B testing, split testing, multivariate testing, and multipage experiment tools.</p> \n<p>Convert also offers an advanced segmentation tool that allows you to segment users based on their historical behavior, cookies, and JavaScript events.</p> \n<p>Additionally, Convert can gauge the performance of all your tests by reporting on a large mix of metrics, from your variations’ clickthrough rate to its return-on-investment.</p> \n<p>If you want to use Convert in conjunction with your other tools, they offer a ton of integrations with third-party tools, like WordPress, Shopify, and HubSpot. Convert is best suited for small businesses.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing: </strong>Starts at $699/month</p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://business.adobe.com/products/target/ab-testing.html\">Adobe Target</a></h3> \n<p>Testing your website is important, but what if you have other channels that you want to test? Adobe Target helps you do exactly that.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-adobe-target.jpg?width=550&amp;name=a_b-testing-tool-adobe-target.jpg\" alt=\"a/b testing tool - adobe target\" width=\"550\" style=\"width: 550px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://business.adobe.com/products/target/ab-testing.html\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>Whether you’re want to test your app’s new home screen or want to experiment on your internet-of-things system, this tool’s got you covered.</p> \n<p>In addition to testing on multiple platforms and devices, Adobe Target also offers testing on both the client and server side, offering advanced features for experienced teams.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing:</strong> Upon request</p> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://leadformly.com/\">Leadformly</a></h3> \n<p>Struggling to capture leads through your forms? Perhaps visitors are leaving right before reaching the final step. Or maybe they leave halfway through completion.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-leadformly.jpg?width=550&amp;name=a_b-testing-tool-leadformly.jpg\" alt=\"a/b testing tool - leadformly\" width=\"550\" style=\"width: 550px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://leadformly.com/\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<p>In any of these cases, you want a tool like Leadformly to help you get to the bottom of this. Even teams with high-converting forms can still benefit from testing their forms, as they may discover additional ways to increase their CVR.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing: </strong>Starts at $37/month</p> Chi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5d42eade-1de3-4ff1-adba-6b1521e6cbde.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn88@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-42-636_1068aaa9a6acaf25.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ab-testing-tool-hubspot.png?width=284&name=ab-testing-tool-hubspot.png":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-google-optimize.jpg?width=550&name=a_b-testing-tool-google-optimize.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-44-405_c5fca6bc022cef23.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-freshmarketer.jpg?width=550&name=a_b-testing-tool-freshmarketer.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn100@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-44-894_30843edc486f9b05.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/pasted%20image%200-26.png?width=500&name=pasted%20image%200-26.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn31@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-46-462_9f6df1a442637b11.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/optimizely-testing.gif?width=550&name=optimizely-testing.gif":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-omniconvert.jpg?width=2580&name=a_b-testing-tool-omniconvert.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn95@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-45-006_6e8649e841666f69.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/pasted%20image%200%20(1)-10.png?width=500&name=pasted%20image%200%20(1)-10.png":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/pasted%20image%200%20(2)-7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn17@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-45-377_c77f1de8da1389b7.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/pasted%20image%200%20(3)-6.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn72@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-44-435_1983e5457235cc79.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-adobe-target.jpg?width=550&name=a_b-testing-tool-adobe-target.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn12@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-45-776_1a674b236db09aa3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/a_b-testing-tool-leadformly.jpg?width=550&name=a_b-testing-tool-leadformly.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn22@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-48-384_85f05613ee60b8a2.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/1fb2d19e-9ff9-40a7-947e-cc67e7d472cb.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn62@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-48-465_39667621be686c34.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fa-b-testing-tools&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn7@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-45-776_d26076ff52abe5dd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741264},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"Predictive Lead Scoring: What It Is and Why It's Important","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/traditional-predictive-lead-scoring","description":"<p>If your marketing team and the systems you have in place to attract leads are working properly, you’re likely seeing anywhere from 10s to 1,000s of new leads each week. If you’ve got a robust sales team, they may be able to contact every single lead within a few hours.</p> \n<p><em></em></p> \n<p>However, if you’re like most companies, your sales team has to prioritize in order to reach out to the “best” prospects quickly, while saving the “less likely” prospects for last. This doesn’t mean that they can’t be converted, there’s just a lower chance of securing those prospects as customers.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=a071fb96-a9b0-4f90-aa1d-5c25c8136252&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Download Now: Free Sales &amp; Marketing Lead Goal Calculator\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a071fb96-a9b0-4f90-aa1d-5c25c8136252.png\"></a></p> \n<p>Time spent courting the wrong prospect is not only an exercise in futility, but it takes time away from your salespeople and prevents them from closing sales and making your company money. How then, do you make the job easier (and more lucrative) for your salespeople?</p> \n<p>Predictive Lead Scoring can take the guesswork out of following up on leads. Let’s take a look at what it is and how it could help your business grow.</p> \n<h2>What is predictive lead scoring?</h2> \n<p>Before we define predictive lead scoring, it’s important to understand traditional lead scoring and its limitations.</p> \n<p>Businesses have struggled with prioritizing lead follow-up for decades. In many cases, salespeople are left to their own devices, using their best judgment to decide who gets contacted first. Marketers and salespeople use data such as demographic info (age, marital status, industry, role), to rank potential customers as to how likely they are to buy. Those who rank high on this scale are contacted first, while others are contacted last, or if time doesn’t permit, not contacted at all.</p> \n<p>The problem with this subjective process is that it’s … subjective. Salespeople are forced to rely on “gut feelings” and factor in their own historical experience to make this decision. Neither of these proves to be consistently accurate causing quality leads to slip through the cracks as they chase prospects unlikely to buy.</p> \n<p>Predictive lead scoring is machine learning that takes this theory one step further by using predictive modeling algorithms to analyze data from past customers and current prospects to predict future outcomes. Put another way, predictive lead scoring has the ability to create an “ideal customer” profile based on past buying behavior, and then identify which current prospects best fit that profile. It removes the possibility for human error or bias and instead relies on hard data to make its predictions.</p> \n<h2>The Benefits of Predictive Lead Scoring</h2> \n<p>If your marketing and sales teams have been struggling with identifying top leads and are unable to follow up with everyone that enters your database, predictive lead scoring may be exactly what your company needs. With a multitude of benefits, it’s like hiring another department to assist in new customer acquisition.</p> \n<p>The benefits of predictive lead scoring include:</p> \n<h3>1. Create Harmony Between Marketing and Sales</h3> \n<p>When there are so many leads coming in but not many sales being closed, these two departments may turn on one another. The marketing department doesn’t understand how they're providing a large number of leads that Sales can’t close. And the sales department believes that quantity is more important than quality, and they aren’t getting any <em>good</em> leads.</p> \n<p>Incorporating predictive lead scoring will help these two departments work together and produce more.</p> \n<h3>2. Save Time</h3> \n<p>An automated lead scoring system means that your marketing and sales teams no longer have to waste time vetting potential customers. Their time can be better spent bringing in more leads and following up on the right ones.</p> \n<h3>3. Remove Human Error</h3> \n<p>No matter how good (and quick) your employees are at reviewing potential customers, there will always be an inherent bias. People can’t approach a situation without drawing on memories of the past. No matter how objective they attempt to be, this bias will creep into every decision they make. Using a computer algorithm to make these decisions removes the possibility of human error or judgment.</p> \n<h3>4. Lightning-Fast Results</h3> \n<p>While it takes a little bit of time to set up, once predictive lead scoring is up and running, you’ll receive results considerably faster than you would if a person were doing the work. You receive high-quality, data-driven leads before a human employee could even get their coffee.</p> \n<h3>5. See Continual Improvement</h3> \n<p>As you close and service more customers, you’ll collect more data. The more data you have, the better predictive lead scoring works and the more data points you’ll have to work with.</p> \n<p>Predictive lead scoring is ready to work for you and make your marketing and sales teams more efficient.</p> \n<h2>How to Incorporate Predictive Lead Scoring in Your Business</h2> \n<p>Now that you understand predictive lead scoring and how it can revolutionize your business, how do you get started?</p> \n<p>HubSpot offers <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/lead-scoring?_ga=2.83103062.194752775.1625243417-947895004.1625243417\">Predictive Lead Scoring software</a> that integrates with your Enterprise CRM, providing machine learning that reviews thousands of data points across your contact base to identify your best leads.</p> \n<p>These data points are drawn from analytics (website and email behavior), firmographic information about the contact’s company and their relationship within HubSpot, and interactions that have been logged in the CRM.</p> \n<p>To use this feature:</p> \n<ol> \n <li>Click the Settings icon in the main navigation bar of your HubSpot account.</li> \n <li>From the left sidebar menu, navigate to CRM &gt; Properties.</li> \n <li>Search in the <em>Contact Information</em> property group for<em> Likelihood to close</em> and <em>Contact priority.</em></li> \n</ol> \n<p><em>Likelihood to close</em> is a score that represents the probability of a contact closing as a customer within the next 90 days. It used standard contact properties and behavior to predict this. If the score or probability value is 22, that means there is a 22% chance of closing as a customer in the next 90 days.</p> \n<p><em>Contact priority</em> uses the<em> Likelihood to close</em> score to filter segments of your best and worst leads.</p> \n<p>As you accumulate more data, the system will improve itself, providing even better predictions and guiding you towards the most important leads. Because the program requires data to do its job, you will not begin seeing values for <em>Contact priority </em>until you have reached 100 contacts.</p> \n<p>If you want to see your organization grow and your team members flourish, predictive lead scoring is essential. Imagine what your business will look like in five, 10, or 15 years when the system you use to attract and acquire new customers is fully optimized.</p> \n<p>Give your marketing and sales teams a leg up on the competition and try predictive lead scoring today.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=a9acb744-e030-4d0d-b01c-dda53a491663&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"How to Calculate Your Lead Goal\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a9acb744-e030-4d0d-b01c-dda53a491663.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ftraditional-predictive-lead-scoring&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 06 Sep 2021 21:45:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a071fb96-a9b0-4f90-aa1d-5c25c8136252.png","linkMd5":"d7d0a1ef93289b6943dac79917dba03b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn80@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-285_64c71326517e4187.webp","destWidth":544,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":6269,"destBytes":8730,"author":"Sheryl Green","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a071fb96-a9b0-4f90-aa1d-5c25c8136252.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn80@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-285_64c71326517e4187.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a9acb744-e030-4d0d-b01c-dda53a491663.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn10@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-45-077_10b93f457b54b8ff.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ftraditional-predictive-lead-scoring&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn16@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-43-911_50f373ffe82f2773.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741242},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"Cloud Integration: 6 Best Cloud Integration Platforms & Tools","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/cloud-integration","description":"<p>Cloud-based applications make it possible for marketing teams to connect with customers, conduct critical research, and make data-driven decisions that can help boost ROI.</p>  \n<p>The challenge? With other business departments using their own sets of cloud apps and services, silos quickly emerge. And this departmental disconnect is growing as application volumes increase: <a href=\"https://www.okta.com/businesses-at-work/2021/\">Recent survey data</a> found that large businesses use 175 cloud-based apps on average, while smaller companies deploy 73 on average.</p> \n<p>Cloud integration platforms offer a way to bridge this digital divide by making it possible for IT teams to monitor and manage disparate applications from a single, centralized system. In this post, we’ll cover what cloud integration is and the best tools you can use to break down departmental silos.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=fd1d8911-635d-4be6-8755-5ab6a332b129&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download&nbsp;Now: Free&nbsp;Marketing Reporting Templates\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/fd1d8911-635d-4be6-8755-5ab6a332b129.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>Cloud Integration: When and How</h2> \n<p>As noted by research firm <a href=\"https://www.gartner.com/en/newsroom/press-releases/2021-04-21-gartner-forecasts-worldwide-public-cloud-end-user-spending-to-grow-23-percent-in-2021\">Gartner</a>, the software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions market is on track to reach more than $122 billion in 2021, fueled in large part by the demand for agile and flexible applications that let teams work anywhere, anytime.</p> \n<p>The more applications your business uses everyday, the more complicated your IT environment becomes. As a result, it’s often worth deploying cloud integration platforms as soon as possible — companies can get familiar with key features and functions before application volumes begin to scale up exponentially.</p> \n<p>Integration itself can be handled in-house by deploying infrastructure and services that support cloud connections, but this approach is time-consuming and costly, even for large enterprises. Cloud integration platforms, meanwhile, are designed to streamline this connective process and reduce the amount of lead time required for deployment.</p> \n<h2>Benefits of Cloud Integration</h2> \n<p>Deploying cloud integration platforms provides several benefits for businesses, including:</p> \n<h3>Improved Collaboration</h3> \n<p>Silos are problematic for small businesses — if marketing teams are using one set of applications and data, while product development, production and HR teams are using another, the results can range from mismatched business objectives that limit ROI to duplicated work that reduces total efficiency.</p> \n<p>Cloud integration platforms offer a way to connect disparate applications and departments, making it possible for teams to leverage and collaborate on the same data in real-time.</p> \n<h3>Increased Visibility</h3> \n<p>Companies also benefit from increased visibility when using cloud integration platforms. By unifying application environments under a single solution, IT teams can easily see what’s happening, when, and why. As a result, companies are better prepared to deal with application conflicts or team requirements as they arise, rather than after the fact.</p> \n<h3>Enhanced Cost Control</h3> \n<p>Cloud applications left unchecked and unmonitored come with significant costs over time, especially if they’re continually collecting or using data. Cloud integration makes it possible for businesses to see what’s running on their network and evaluate how often applications are used, allowing them to better manage and monitor overall technology costs.</p> \n<h2>Potential Pitfalls of Cloud Integration</h2> \n<p>Generally speaking, cloud integration platforms streamline the deployment, use, and monitoring of cloud-based applications. The evolution of this market vertical means that substantive challenges are few and far between, but there is a potential pitfall that businesses must address: Choosing the right platform.</p> \n<p>With a host of options now available and each offering a different mix of features and functions, it’s easy to get bogged down in the details. The result? Businesses may end up selecting a platform that performs adequately rather than exceptionally given their specific mix of applications, services, and staff needs.</p> \n<p>Need some help finding your best fit? Let’s break down the top cloud integration platforms, as rated by trusted review site G2.</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.jitterbit.com/\">JitterBit</a></h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.g2.com/products/jitterbit/reviews\">G2 Rating</a>: 4.7/5.0 (228 Reviews)</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/jitterbit-cloud-integration-platform.png?width=650&amp;name=jitterbit-cloud-integration-platform.png\" alt=\"Cloud integration platform: Jitterbit\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">As one of the <a href=\"https://info.jitterbit.com/gartner-mq-eipaas-report-2020.html\">leaders in the iPaaS space</a>, JitterBit lets you fuse thousands of SaaS, cloud, and on-premises applications into one interface. You can also leverage their pre-built templates and workflows to automate your business processes. Additionally, you can create new <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/website/application-programming-interface-api\">application programming interfaces (APIs)</a> from your existing enterprise applications or data on their API platform. You can even blend your newly created APIs with external APIs to roll out new business solutions.</p> \n<p><em>What we like:</em></p> \n<p>Jitterbit is all about making it easy for companies to connect applications and APIs in days rather than weeks. The solution is used by thousands of companies worldwide and includes powerful app and API integration tools that empower businesses to not only streamline key processes but collect intelligence data on-demand.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/operations\">Operations Hub</a></h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.g2.com/products/piesync/reviews\">G2 Rating</a>: 4.6/5.0 (297 Reviews)</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/operations-hub-cloud-integration-platform.png?width=650&amp;name=operations-hub-cloud-integration-platform.png\" alt=\"Cloud integration platform: Operations Hub\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Operations Hub leverages intelligent 2-way sync technology from PieSync to update any customer’s information in one app after it changes in the other. The cloud integration platform also gives you complete control over the apps you choose to sync, consolidates customer information from multiple apps, and stores and updates all your data in one place so you can access it and make the most accurate data-driven decisions for your business.</p> \n<h4>What We Like</h4> \n<p>Sure, we’re a bit biased, but the fact remains that Operations Hub is one of the best-reviewed cloud integration solutions on G2. With a host of tools including data sync, data quality automation, and the ability to slice and dice data on-demand, Operations Hub has everything you need to run — and grow — your business.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://zapier.com/\">Zapier</a></h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.g2.com/products/zapier/reviews\">G2 Rating</a>: 4.5/5.0 (729 Reviews)</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/zapier-cloud-integration-platform.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=zapier-cloud-integration-platform.jpeg\" alt=\"Cloud integration platform: Zapier\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">With the ability to connect to and share data with over 1,000 web apps, like Facebook, QuickBooks, and Google Drive, Zapier can automate almost any type of business process. All you have to do is build a workflow in their editor, pick the apps you want to include in your workflow, and watch your apps work together without additional intervention.</p> \n<h4>What We Like</h4> \n<p>Zapier is based on three key principles: Integrate, automate and innovate. Integration links web apps in just a few clicks, automation passes data between applications using workflows called “Zaps,” and innovation lets you build better processes with no code required. All told? It’s a win-win-win.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.mulesoft.com/platform/enterprise-integration\">MuleSoft Anypoint Platform</a></h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.g2.com/products/mulesoft-anypoint-platform/reviews\">G2 Rating</a>: 4.5/5.0 (495 Reviews)</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/mulesoft-cloud-integration-platform.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=mulesoft-cloud-integration-platform.jpeg\" alt=\"Cloud integration platform: MuleSoft\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Trusted by over 1,600 enterprise companies, MuleSoft Anypoint Platform lets you manage all your APIs and integrations on one platform. You can also build and integrate your APIs; integrate with any application, data, or device; deploy on-premises integrations to the cloud without rewriting any code; and protect your data and administer access to employees by leveraging edge gateways and encryption.</p> \n<h4>What We Like</h4> \n<p>Mulesoft is all about speed and simplicity. Reusable API assets make it easy to create app integrations with just a few clicks, and machine-learning recommendations help automatically transform data. Plus, businesses get real-time visibility into APIs and integrations from a single interface.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://www.ibm.com/cloud/app-connect\">IBM App Connect</a></h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.g2.com/products/ibm-app-connect/reviews\">G2 Rating</a>: 4.3/5.0 (207 Reviews)</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ibm-appconnect-cloud-integration-platform.png?width=650&amp;name=ibm-appconnect-cloud-integration-platform.png\" alt=\"Cloud integration platform: IBM App Connect\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">With IBM App Connect, you can integrate your data between on-premises and cloud-based applications, build APIs on an intuitive, code-free interface, and build workflows that automate your business processes within different apps. You can also deploy IBM App Connect in any cloud or on-premises environment.</p> \n<h4>What We Like</h4> \n<p>Part of the appeal here is that IBM has long been a leader in the technology integrations and operations space, but it’s the specifics of the solution that really set it apart. Using prebuilt app connectors and agile integration architecture (AIA), organizations can easily connect all apps across all environments for maximum operational flexibility.</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://boomi.com/\">Dell Boomi</a></h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.g2.com/products/dell-boomi/reviews\">G2 Rating</a>: 4.2/5.0 (222 Reviews)</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/dell-boomi-cloud-integration-platform.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=dell-boomi-cloud-integration-platform.jpeg\" alt=\"Cloud integration platform: Dell Boomi\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">Trusted by over 8,000 brands, Dell Boomi lets you fuse all your digital platforms into one. By uniting all your data, applications, and processes, Boomi essentially stores all of your technology systems and assets in one place. With Boomi, you can also manage your APIs, maintain the quality of your data, build workflows with minimal coding knowledge, and develop applications.</p> \n<h4>What We Like</h4> \n<p>With more than 15,000 customers worldwide, Boomi remains one of the top cloud integration platforms. The Dell solution focuses on three key areas: Data, systems, and people. It promises instant integration of all three to help accelerate and simplify cloud-based operations.</p> \n<h2>Making the Most of Cloud Integration</h2> \n<p>Cloud integration platforms can help streamline and simplify application management across your small business. More importantly, they can help break down operational silos by providing a way for teams to collaborate and connect regardless of how, when, or where they use company data. This will empower your team to deliver actionable insights and make the most of cloud-based applications at scale.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in May 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=3cb695d9-7dc5-4e70-8523-1e330e6bd58a&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img
