Bennett","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3e2abb94-93d9-4cf5-bd8e-6a96ecc14270.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn56@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-315_ccb05f23cfee781e.webp","https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/D93NmdMzrpkjlFA8tw7Ga7PJd-mjsUVshgJD7QnZpKzNOXsYMIpi0EX6Cs5POkmjwjuBHk_VXRRbBajUnmshZ7wT2nNN4_PzVGhE7xIwnK_LGHLOGeYTbKdkZc1wCHvx6fSE1ozF=s0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn7@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-44-167_a472ed5d7d93b577.webp","https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/HasjXlMr_yjdOQ48jxYsHUNGcg7_5a51jLbvRjgfV8IVqxgbDJDwt1J4yF8VgOljLNyjV5uCKoLAonzeywxh97w53sK40B7HvuhMejvkMMPbChCK8toO_C6dCmd47HWu-KdFf3Mz=s0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn57@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-51-985_87e4dfdd301dcfde.webp","https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/0lWwgKhpSBsRZnEcko97E1KCZHCLydLThiiy0VQPYd269CG436wfYozWKLBBSS1q7ElmNRkIYoIy3VvhsOWqxIElYdE5IOs43b9El04X0z3cU96226nu8sOFo6C09JMqEB43XwVS=s0":null,"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/bilnYHsQsRmlxY-8E-4R3VtU7adxb7E-UAhq_ieoYiMroix_ui2DeiFB4QE4S8Lbht-xwKqVX-P-0-tp5bZN2MSTjJp7VCM6XO0ZuGfSYdjNRgfEa402LIvL_5sqSlvzkjuedvUV=s0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-46-042_76cfa62a15b5fa3b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Department-Budget-Template.jpg?width=971&name=Department-Budget-Template.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn35@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-47-066_a6bad6ee996b2495.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/fec839c8-058f-4d11-8943-c7e0c554fa27.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn41@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-47-706_af961930029e625f.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbusiness-budget-template&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741257},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"YouTube Demographics & Data to Know in 2021 [+What Different Generations Watch on the Platform]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/youtube-demographics","description":"<p>Chances are, you've probably spent an afternoon falling down a rabbit hole of <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/youtube-marketing?_ga=2.61102124.183047792.1613143702-1870165885.1613143702\">YouTube</a> videos.</p>  \n<p>I certainly have, and I think I'd be pretty embarrassed to see the total amount of time I've spent on the platform.</p> \n<p>While it's a great source of entertainment, YouTube has also proved itself to be a valuable tool for marketers. In fact, <a href=\"https://blog.google/products/ads/new-ways-to-drive-action/?_ga=2.122735113.366374710.1611185634-867922050.1611185634&amp;_gac=1.184789851.1611271695.CjwKCAiA6aSABhApEiwA6Cbm_0ZIYIKsU4Pd9_mXwJwmJhKUNjEtQ4lFp-SzRZendLORVEEUUORWCBoCImkQAvD_BwE\">70% of viewers</a> bought from a brand after seeing content on YouTube. And, with a global user base of more than <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/intl/en-GB/about/press/\">2 billion people</a>, it's also safe to assume that your target audience is on the platform.</p> \n<p>However, just as it is for all social networks, building a presence on YouTube requires understanding <em>which</em> segments of your audience are already there and what they're watching. Having that information makes it easier to create content that speaks to their interests, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/measure-content-marketing-roi\">maximize ROI, </a>and achieve general marketing success. In this post, we'll go over key YouTube statistics you need to know for 2021 to help you succeed in your marketing efforts.</p> \n<div> \n <h2><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b33cfd44-133a-49e3-a943-086c5679d485&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Free Templates: How to Use YouTube for Business [Download Now]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b33cfd44-133a-49e3-a943-086c5679d485.png\" align=\"middle\"></a>2021 YouTube Demographics</h2> \n <p>Below, we'll go over the most critical YouTube statistics that show marketers how global audiences are using the platform.</p> \n <h3>General YouTube User Demographics</h3> \n <ul> \n  <li>YouTube is the second most visited website in the world. (<a href=\"https://www.hootsuite.com/resources/digital-trends\">Hootsuite</a>)</li> \n  <li>YouTube accounts for more than 25% of total worldwide mobile traffic. (<a href=\"https://www.sandvine.com/press-releases/sandvine-releases-2020-mobile-internet-phenomena-report-youtube-is-over-25-of-all-mobile-traffic\">Sandvine</a>)</li> \n  <li>YouTube has 2+ billion users, making up almost one-third of the entire internet. (<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/intl/en-GB/about/press/\">YouTube for Press</a>)</li> \n  <li>These 2+ billion users are present in over 100 countries and consume content in 80 different languages. (<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/intl/en-GB/about/press/\">YouTube for Press</a>)</li> \n  <li>YouTube users watch one billion hours of content daily. (<a href=\"https://www.hootsuite.com/resources/digital-trends\">Hootsuite</a>)</li> \n  <li>YouTube is the second most popular channel for businesses sharing video content. (<a href=\"https://buffer.com/state-of-social-2019\">Buffer</a>)</li> \n  <li>70% of viewers bought from a brand after seeing content on YouTube. (<a href=\"https://blog.google/products/ads/new-ways-to-drive-action/?_ga=2.122735113.366374710.1611185634-867922050.1611185634&amp;_gac=1.184789851.1611271695.CjwKCAiA6aSABhApEiwA6Cbm_0ZIYIKsU4Pd9_mXwJwmJhKUNjEtQ4lFp-SzRZendLORVEEUUORWCBoCImkQAvD_BwE\">Google Ads</a>)</li> \n  <li>YouTube will make 5.6 billion in advertising revenue in 2021 in the U.S. (<a href=\"https://www.emarketer.com/content/us-youtube-advertising-2020\">eMarketer</a>)</li> \n  <li>YouTube is the top video streaming app, and the average user spends 23.2 hours per month watching content. (<a href=\"https://www.appannie.com/en/go/state-of-mobile-2021/?utm_source=digital-2021&amp;utm_medium=partnership&amp;utm_campaign=ww-logo-201910-1910-digital-2021-partnership&amp;utm_content=report-&amp;sfdcid=7016F000002MS1c\">App Annie</a>)</li> \n  <li>The most popular YouTube search query is \"song.\" (<a href=\"https://www.hootsuite.com/resources/digital-trends\">Hootsuite</a>)</li> \n  <li>The most popular YouTube video is Pinkfong's Kids Songs &amp; Stories Baby Shark Dance, with 7.85 billion views. (<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/249396/top-youtube-videos-views/\">Statista</a>)</li> \n  <li>The three most popular videos on YouTube are commentary videos (like vlogs), product reviews (like unboxings), and how-to/tutorial style videos. (<a href=\"https://mediakix.com/blog/most-popular-youtube-videos/\">MediaKix</a>)</li> \n  <li>Global users watched over 100 billion hours of gaming content in 2020. (<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/trends/articles/2020-youtube-gaming-stats/\">YouTube</a>)</li> \n  <li>YouTube TV ended Q3 2020 with 3 million subscribers. (<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_EFJ_2QuRk4&amp;feature=youtu.be\">Alphabet</a>)</li> \n  <li>70% of people used YouTube to exercise in 2020. (<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/trends/articles/report-sources/\">YouTube</a>)</li> \n  <li>Livestreams on YouTube grew 45% in the first half of 2020. (<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/trends/articles/report-sources/\">YouTube</a>)</li> \n </ul> \n <h3>YouTube Age Demographics</h3> \n <ul> \n  <li>In Q3 2020, 77% of 15-to-25-year-olds and 70% of 45-to-64-year-olds in the U.S. used YouTube. (<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/296227/us-youtube-reach-age-gender/\">Statista</a>)</li> \n  <li>21.2% of YouTube's global audience is between 25 and 34, and 17% is between 35 and 44. (<a href=\"https://www.hootsuite.com/resources/digital-trends\">Hootsuite</a>)</li> \n  <li>80% of U.S. parents with a child age 11 or younger say their child watches videos on YouTube, and 53% of those children use the platform daily. (<a href=\"https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/2020/07/28/parental-views-about-youtube/\">Pew Research Center</a>)</li> \n  <li>Outside of China, 77% of Gen Z, 75% of millennials, 61% of Gen X, and 44% of Baby Boomers visit YouTube daily. (<a href=\"https://www.globalwebindex.com/reports/social\">GlobalWebIndex</a>)</li> \n  <li>18-to-34-year-olds use YouTube to view video content on their TVs 7.9% more often than basic cable and 14.5% than premium cable. (<a href=\"https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/youtube-2-billion-users-tv-screen-watch-time-hours-1203204267/\">Variety</a>)</li> \n  <li>46% of Gen Z and Millennials in the U.S. and UK say they've watched a virtual event on YouTube. (<a href=\"https://www.globalwebindex.com/reports/social\">GlobalWebIndex</a>)</li> \n </ul> \n <h3>YouTube Gender Demographics</h3> \n <p style=\"font-size: 11px;\"><em><span style=\"font-size: 18px;\"> Please note that audience data for individuals who do not identify as cisgender men and women are not reported.</span> </em></p> \n <ul> \n  <li>45.8% of YouTube's total advertising audience is female. (<a href=\"https://www.hootsuite.com/resources/digital-trends\">Hootsuite</a>)</li> \n  <li>54.2% of YouTube's total advertising audience is male. (<a href=\"https://www.hootsuite.com/resources/digital-trends\">Hootsuite</a>)</li> \n  <li>Male and female internet users in the United States use YouTube at equal levels. (<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/810461/us-youtube-reach-gender/\">Statista</a>)</li> \n </ul> \n <h3>YouTube Geography Demographics</h3> \n <ul> \n  <li>As of February 2021, 16.6% of YouTube site visits come from the United States, 9.4% comes from India, and 4.9% comes from Japan. (<a href=\"https://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/youtube.com\">Alexa</a>)</li> \n  <li>YouTube has launched local versions of the platform in more than 100 countries. (<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/intl/en-GB/about/press/\">YouTube for Press</a>)</li> \n  <li>eMarketer predicts that the number of YouTube users in India will reach 342 million in 2021. (<a href=\"https://www.emarketer.com/content/netflix-struggles-to-gain-foothold-in-indian-market-youtube-benefits-from-increasing-digital-video-viewers\">eMarketer</a>)</li> \n  <li>86% of U.S. viewers say they often use YouTube to learn new things. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/youtube-learning-statistics/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n </ul> \n <h2>What Different Generations Watch on YouTube</h2> \n <h3>What Gen Z Watches on YouTube</h3> \n <ul> \n  <li>85% of teens use YouTube, making it the most popular among teens. (<a href=\"https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/2018/05/31/teens-social-media-technology-2018/pi_2018-05-31_teenstech_0-01/\">Pew Research</a>)</li> \n  <li>7 in 10 said watching videos with others helps them feel more connected. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/gen-z-and-youtube/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n  <li>80% of Gen Z teens say YouTube has helped them become more knowledgeable about something. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/gen-z-and-youtube/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n  <li>68% of Gen Z teens say YouTube has helped them improve or gain skills that will help them prepare for the future. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/gen-z-and-youtube/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n  <li>When asked which platforms they turn to when they want to relax or cheer up, Gen Zers said YouTube was number one. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/gen-z-and-youtube/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n  <li>Eight in 10 of Gen Z teens said they proactively share YouTube videos with their parents or other adult family members. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/gen-z-and-youtube/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n </ul> \n <h4>Takeaways for Video Marketers</h4> \n <p>Based on the research, Gen Z turns to YouTube when they want to learn something or improve a skill. They also use the platform to deepen real-life connections and take a break from the stress of being a teenager. If you're targeting Gen Z, educational and entertaining content will reign supreme.</p> \n <h3>What Millennials Watch on YouTube</h3> \n <div> \n  <ul> \n   <li>70% of millennial users watched YouTube in the past year to learn how to do something new or learn more about something they're interested in. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/youtube-millennials-behavior-statistics/\">Think with Google</a>)</li> \n   <li>Nearly 60% of millennial women on YouTube say they are more likely to remember a brand that's LGBT-friendly. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/youtube-millennials-behavior-statistics/\">Think with Google</a>)</li> \n  </ul> \n  <div> \n   <ul style=\"font-size: 18px;\"> \n    <li>45% of millennial YouTube users agree that a YouTuber inspired them to make a personal change in their life. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/youtube-millennials-behavior-statistics/\">Think with Google</a>)</li> \n    <li>YouTube reaches more millennials than all the TV networks combined. (<a href=\"https://www.theshelf.com/the-blog/youtube-habits/\">The Shelf</a>)</li> \n    <li>When learning something new, millennials are <strong>2.7X as likely</strong> to prefer to do so by watching a YouTube video compared to reading a book. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/youtube-millennials-behavior-statistics/\">Think with Google</a>)</li> \n    <li>Millennials prefer watching: \n     <ul style=\"font-size: 18px;\"> \n      <li>News and human interest stories to keep up to date</li> \n      <li>Unboxing and product review videos to influence spending</li> \n      <li>Quick and fun entertainment content (<a href=\"https://www.theshelf.com/the-blog/youtube-habits/\">The Shelf</a>)</li> \n     </ul> </li> \n   </ul> \n  </div> \n </div> \n <h4>Takeaways for Video Marketers</h4> \n <p>Similar to Gen Z, millennials go to YouTube when they want to learn something or be entertained. Additionally, they go to the platform to be inspired, watch TV, and catch up on the news. If you're targeting millennials, news stories, product reviews, entertaining content, and inspiring content will win out.</p> \n <h3>What Gen X Watches on YouTube</h3> \n <ul> \n  <li>75% of Gen Xers watch YouTube videos that relate to past events or people. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/marketing-generation-x-youtube-behavior-trends/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n  <li>Gen Xers search for things such as \"Prince Purple Rain\" or \"Commercials from the 90s\" on YouTube. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/marketing-generation-x-youtube-behavior-trends/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n  <li>Gen Xers spend more time watching video content on their computers and smartphones than they are on traditional TV. (<a href=\"https://www.nielsen.com/us/en/insights/article/2015/age-of-technology-generational-video-viewing-preferences-vary-by-device-and-activity/\">Nielson</a>)</li> \n  <li>73% of Gen Xers watch YouTube to learn how to do something. Similarly, they enjoy DIY content for things like cooking and home repair. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/marketing-generation-x-youtube-behavior-trends/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n  <li>68% of Gen Xers watch YouTube to stay up to date on news and pop culture. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/marketing-generation-x-youtube-behavior-trends/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n </ul> \n <h4>Takeaways for Video Marketers</h4> \n <p>Gen Xers are goal-oriented. They usually go to YouTube with a purpose -- either to learn something, watch nostalgic videos, or stay up to date on news and pop culture. To properly target Gen Xers, consider posting DIY videos and throwback content.</p> \n <h3>What Boomers Watch on YouTube</h3> \n <div> \n  <div> \n   <div> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Some of baby boomers' most-watched categories on YouTube are entertainment, music, and news. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/consumer-insights/consumer-trends/baby-boomer-most-watched-youtube-categories/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n     <li style=\"font-weight: normal;\">67% of Baby Boomers, ages 57 – 75, watch YouTube. (<a href=\"https://www.theshelf.com/the-blog/youtube-habits/\">The Shelf</a>)</li> \n     <li style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Boomers are 1.3X more likely to prefer watching a YouTube tutorial video than reading instructions. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/baby-boomer-youtube-trends/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n     <li style=\"font-weight: normal;\">1 in 3 boomers say they use YouTube to learn about a product or service. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/baby-boomer-youtube-trends/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n     <li style=\"font-weight: normal;\">68% of boomers say they watch YouTube videos to be entertained. (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/marketing-strategies/video/baby-boomer-youtube-trends/\">Think With Google</a>)</li> \n    </ul> \n   </div> \n  </div> \n </div> \n <h4>Takeaways for Video Marketers</h4> \n <p>Baby boomers have the most spending power of any generation and they go to YouTube to learn how to use products and watch tutorials. Additionally, they want to save time. If they can catch up on their favorite news and entertainment on the site, that's where they go. If you're targeting Boomers on YouTube, you can post how-to and tutorial content.</p> \n <h2>How to Target the Right Demographic on YouTube</h2> \n <p>While each generation might watch fairly similar content, it's important to remember that the goal is different. For Gen X it might be to reminisce, while for Boomers it's to save time, and for Millenials and Gen Z it's to learn something new.</p> \n <p>To properly target the right demographic on YouTube, pay attention to the most popular categories and types of videos they watch on the platform.</p> \n <h3>Let Data Drive Your YouTube Strategy</h3> \n <p>Use these statistics to create a YouTube marketing strategy that speaks to your audience's interests, drives revenue, and increases conversions.</p> \n <p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in April 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n <p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=7e8681b3-9162-45a4-b6a1-f33ff244a78a&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/7e8681b3-9162-45a4-b6a1-f33ff244a78a.png\"></a></p> \n <p></p> \n</div>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fyoutube-demographics&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 10 Sep 2021 15:45:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b33cfd44-133a-49e3-a943-086c5679d485.png","linkMd5":"7335aaa75de1f1cd0b21ce0aabf8ee56","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn92@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-676_cf13f3171c1652e5.webp","destWidth":625,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":6230,"destBytes":9478,"author":"fneedle@hubspot.com (Flori Needle)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b33cfd44-133a-49e3-a943-086c5679d485.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn92@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-676_cf13f3171c1652e5.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/7e8681b3-9162-45a4-b6a1-f33ff244a78a.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn20@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-46-130_61f66f8328bd53cd.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fyoutube-demographics&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn47@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-46-447_67706a26d8ca4ec8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741236},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"Direct vs. Indirect Competition, Explained","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/direct-indirect-competition","description":"<p>Competition is essential for growth, but only when a business properly evaluates its competitors and betters itself to keep up. Even in marketing, analyzing the competition is healthy and can help inspire you to learn and adapt the business to better meet consumer needs.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Part of the way to do this is by understanding direct and indirect competition and how each can impact your work. Once you know the differences, you can determine how to best identify and evaluate your competitors — both direct and indirect.</p> \n<h2>What is direct competition?</h2> \n<p>When you think of a marketing competitor, you likely think of your direct competitors. Direct competitors are other businesses offering the same services for the same client needs in the same market as you.</p> \n<p>So, let’s say your marketing firm primarily works with restaurants in the western U.S. There are certainly other firms focused on restaurant marketing specifically in the western U.S., and those firms would be your direct competition.</p> \n<p>Even the smallest markets will have direct competition, which is important to prevent monopolies.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: Market Research Templates [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h3>Direct Competition Examples</h3> \n<p>There are many examples of direct competition. McDonald’s, Wendy’s, and Burger King are all direct competitors. Similarly, consider the infamous fast-food chicken sandwich wars, when major restaurant chains like Popeyes, KFC, Wendy’s, Zaxby’s, and more all launched chicken sandwiches to appeal to the same consumer base across the U.S..</p> \n<p>Competition doesn’t just apply to huge, national or international brands. Two women’s fashion boutiques in a small, rural town are also direct competitors.</p> \n<p>Digital companies also see direct competition. For example, Instagram and Snapchat offer very similar features, like disappearing stories and direct messaging, to their target audiences.</p> \n<h2>Indirect Competition Examples</h2> \n<p>Let’s say we have a client base in a small town. The customers are hungry, and often frequent the main drag to have dinner. Here, there are four major restaurants — all of which offer different types of food. Although the products they offer are different, the restaurants all stand for the same purpose: to feed hungry clientele in the town.</p> \n<p>Similarly, consider a client who needs to buy gifts for a birthday party. One store sells clothing. A store across the street sells jewelry. Despite the different products, the two stores are competing for the same customer.</p> \n<h2>Direct and Indirect Competition in Marketing</h2> \n<p>When it comes to marketing, knowing your direct and indirect competition can help you improve your campaigns and even reach new audiences.</p> \n<p>The aforementioned chicken sandwich wars are a great example here. Popeyes launched its highly touted fried chicken sandwich with a powerful marketing campaign. Direct competitors — other fast-food restaurants that sell chicken sandwiches — were able to use marketing to showcase their own entries into the so-called competition.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>The result? The chicken sandwich wars have been heavily covered by major media for the past couple years. Customers have lined up in droves at various fast food restaurants to try the latest and claimed-to-be-greatest chicken sandwiches.</p> \n<p>On the other hand, analyzing your indirect competition can help marketers tap into a wider audience. If you know people shopping for gifts are choosing between your store and similar shops that offer different products, you can create campaigns to draw in those customers. Digitally, indirect competitors might be targeting the same keywords, and understanding that can help boost SEO and get your business to the top of the search engine results page (SERP).</p> \n<h3>1. Customer Feedback</h3> \n<p>One quick way to identify your competitors is to ask your current clients or potential clients. For example, if you have a potential customer come in with questions about your products or services, ask them some other businesses they are considering for this purchase. Send feedback surveys that ask customers what other brands they were considering and why they went with yours.</p> \n<h3>2. Market Research</h3> \n<p>This requires some digging on your end. If you have a brick-and-mortar, you’ll need to review similar stores, their websites, and their social media to get a better idea of their businesses. Customer surveys can also fall into the market research category.</p> \n<h3>3. Social Media</h3> \n<p>Many people share their purchasing experiences on social media and forum websites like Reddit. Check out the recommendations people are sharing for products or services that you also sell to help identify top competitors in your market.</p> \n<h3>4. Keyword Research</h3> \n<p>For indirect competitors, turn to keyword research. You can use the keywords you are targeting to identify other businesses that are targeting the same keywords, and ultimately, the same top spot on the SERP and the same audience.</p> \n<h3>5. Review the SERP</h3> \n<p>Speaking of the SERP, it can also be a handy tool to identify your competitors. Search your keywords to find what businesses are ranking highly for these keywords to see your indirect competitors.</p> \n<h2>Tracking and Analyzing Competitors</h2> \n<p>Now you know the differences between direct and indirect competitors, and you’ve narrowed down a list of both related to your business. What next?</p> \n<p>It’s time to conduct a competitive analysis, which will help you improve your own business strategies when comparing them to your competitors.</p> \n<p>There are <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/competitive-analysis-kit?__hstc=45788219.3d878fa03537367db88b497b30e7d615.1625243078200.1625243078200.1625243078200.1&amp;__hssc=45788219.1.1625243078200&amp;__hsfp=939966733&amp;_ga=2.50096613.2103912915.1625243077-1473090798.1625243077\">several items to include in a competitive analysis</a>: direct and indirect competitors, products/services sold, competitors’ sales tactics, pricing and sales, marketing and content strategies, and social media and websites.</p> \n<p>This comprehensive data will give you a better idea of how your competitors are operating on every level, from the products they sell to their customer service, all online and offline.</p> \n<p>Researching competitors, products, services, keywords, and marketing tactics adds up to a lot of data that needs sorted and organized, so <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/competitive-analysis-templates?__hstc=45788219.3d878fa03537367db88b497b30e7d615.1625243078200.1625243078200.1625243078200.1&amp;__hssc=45788219.1.1625243078200&amp;__hsfp=939966733&amp;_ga=2.50096613.2103912915.1625243077-1473090798.1625243077\">HubSpot’s competitive analysis templates</a> can make light work of these tasks.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/competitive-analysis-templates?hubs_post-cta=image\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/competitive-analysis-template.jpg?width=472&amp;name=competitive-analysis-template.jpg\" alt=\"a template for competitive analysis\" width=\"472\" style=\"width: 472px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></a>For example, this Content Marketing Competitive Analysis Template can help you track competitors’ strategies across social, blogs, email, and SEO.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/competitive-analysis-templates?hubs_post-cta=image\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/multi-feature-scoring-card.jpg?width=481&amp;name=multi-feature-scoring-card.jpg\" alt=\"scoring card for multiple features\" width=\"481\" style=\"width: 481px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></a>This multi-feature scorecard will allow you to compare your company to its competitors based on a number of customizable attributes.</p> \n<p>There are many different templates to consider when creating a visual competitive analysis, so find the one that best suits your needs. You might find using multiple for different comparisons can also be useful.</p> \n<h2>Use Direct and Indirect Competition Analysis to Your Benefit</h2> \n<p>A little healthy competition never hurt anybody, but you have to know how to play the game. By identifying and analyzing your competitors, you can get a leg up on the competition by improving your marketing strategies, focusing on your target audience, and reaching potential new clients.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdirect-indirect-competition&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 06 Sep 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da.png","linkMd5":"12fc6590e6fea803ba23f612a8ba4955","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn9@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-699_3c323ccea639359f.webp","destWidth":486,"destHeight":60,"sourceBytes":5174,"destBytes":7456,"author":"Paige Bennett","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn9@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-699_3c323ccea639359f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/competitive-analysis-template.jpg?width=472&name=competitive-analysis-template.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn6@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-44-994_0f74898f70013a7a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/multi-feature-scoring-card.jpg?width=481&name=multi-feature-scoring-card.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn34@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-48-511_3a33983c2c49741f.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn62@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-46-985_56bafbfb62a605be.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdirect-indirect-competition&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn50@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-44-366_ca1f8b0e1b9f81d0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741252},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"5 Email Unsubscribe Button Ideas That Could Save Subscribers","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/unsubscribe-button-best-practices","description":"<p>Do you ever wish you could unsubscribe from a conversation? As an introvert, I do, quite often. Though unsubscribing from a conversation with another person isn’t always possible (and could potentially be seen as rude), unsubscribing from emails is perfectly acceptable behavior.</p> \n<p>As a consumer, the unsubscribe button can feel like a gift from the divine when your inbox is overflowing. As a marketer, the unsubscribe button can be standing between you and your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-guide\"><span>email marketing</span></a> goals if your list undergoes a mass exodus faster than you’re able to bring in new leads.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=400cd460-b98f-401b-a565-0dc8cd51719c&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: 28 Free CTA Templates\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/400cd460-b98f-401b-a565-0dc8cd51719c.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>However, the unsubscribe button in your emails doesn't have to be feared. In fact, when leveraged wisely, the unsubscribe button can be a powerful tool that helps you curate an engaged email list of your ideal customers who are ready and willing to hear your message.</p> \n<p>Let’s break down the ins and outs of the email unsubscribe button, and how to set it up in a way that helps your business.</p> \n<h2>What is an unsubscribe button?</h2> \n<p>An unsubscribe button is a link or button module typically found at the bottom of a marketing email that gives email subscribers the chance to opt-out of future messages with one simple click.</p> \n<h3>Why Have An Unsubscribe Button</h3> \n<p>I know, the idea of subscribers leaving your list may prompt a bit of panic, especially if you have aggressive list-building goals. However, having an unsubscribe button or link can be to your benefit. One of the most important <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/metrics-email-marketers-should-be-tracking\"><span>email marketing metrics</span></a> you should measure is your open rate or the percentage of people on your list who actually open (and likely read) your emails.</p> \n<p>If you have a large number of subscribers who are on your list but don’t want to be, that can significantly drive down your open rates (and negatively impact your click-through rate). Having a large email list isn’t valuable if your audience doesn’t actually want to engage with your emails, because that could indicate they are even less likely to buy your products.</p> \n<p>Having an unsubscribe button makes it easy for those who are uninterested to opt-out of communication, freeing up space for potential subscribers who are genuinely interested in your message and product.</p> \n<h3>Do you have to have an unsubscribe button in your emails?</h3> \n<p>You may be wondering, \"Do I <em>have</em> to have an unsubscribe button in all of my emails?\"</p> \n<p>The short answer is yes, yes you do.</p> \n<p>In the US, the <a href=\"https://www.ftc.gov/tips-advice/business-center/guidance/can-spam-act-compliance-guide-business\"><span>CAN-SPAM Act</span></a> requires all businesses using email to include clear instructions on how to opt-out on all email communications and these opt-out requests must be honored by law. Businesses that violate the CAN-SPAM Act can face hefty fines for each email violation, so it’s in your best interest to make sure you give your subscribers a chance to opt out in every email communication you send.</p> \n<p>Beyond the CAN-SPAM Act, there are <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbescommunicationscouncil/2021/05/26/four-tips-for-global-email-marketing-compliance/?sh=7fb51df01498\"><span>global email marketing regulations</span></a> that are designed to protect consumers and ensure they’re able to opt out of communications they no longer want to receive. People <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/why-consumers-subscribe-to-email\"><span>unsubscribe from emails</span></a> for a number of reasons, and it’s important for businesses to honor that decision.</p> \n<h2>Unsubscribe Button Best Practices and Ethics</h2> \n<p>Now let’s cover unsubscribe do’s and don’ts.</p> \n<h3>1. Make sure your unsubscribe button uses clear language.</h3> \n<p>Avoid using confusing language or making your unsubscribe button or link difficult to understand. Doing so can be a CAN-SPAM violation. Your unsubscribe option should be clear and easy to understand for the average person.</p> \n<h3>2. Don’t hide your unsubscribe options or make them difficult to see.</h3> \n<p>Your unsubscribe button or link should be visually accessible for readers. Companies that purposefully hide or make the unsubscribe feature difficult to see can also be subject to fines and legal repercussions so avoid using fonts or colors that make your unsubscribe options hard to find or visually inaccessible.</p> \n<h3>3. Offer the option to update email preferences.</h3> \n<p>If your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-email-marketing-services\"><span>email service provider</span></a> gives you the option, allow subscribers to update their email preferences. Perhaps they don’t want to opt out of all communications but would prefer to receive messages about specific topics or want to hear from your company less often. Doing so can help spare unsubscribes while fostering trust with your readers.</p> \n<h3>4. Avoid using negative language.</h3> \n<p>Though it may not violate any laws, having rude or whiny language in your materials when people unsubscribe can come across as needy and unprofessional, and can be a big turn-off. Honor your contact’s decision to unsubscribe, and focus on those who want to engage with your content and products.</p> \n<h3>5. Don’t require a login to unsubscribe.</h3> \n<p>Ideally, the ability to unsubscribe should be one to two simple clicks away for most users. Requiring contacts to retrieve login information or gating the unsubscribe process creates friction and can lead to frustration.</p> \n<h3>6. Include links to your company’s social media profiles.</h3> \n<p>While having a user on your email list gives you more control over when and how your company is able to communicate with them, having contacts unsubscribe doesn’t mean that’s the end-all-be-all of them interacting with your company. Make sure your emails include links to your company’s social media profiles so users who would rather keep in touch on those platforms can easily follow along.</p> \n<h2>Unsubscribe Button Examples</h2> \n<p>Looking for unsubscribe button inspiration? Check out these options.</p> \n<h3>Marketing Brew</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/RiJ4unTzXsoHNHP8zmqel_qijjNw4-rR3AqEYfyGax50pg6B5-I9CcOD-jMx9P9L41mATuOzX-tCbPFPkBgXXcsk96y6z0wwVHGkH3viPlwPAXk0mvtyq72G7UxbJxxMziCPyNNP=s0\" width=\"624\" height=\"144\" alt=\"Unsubscribe button example from The Marketing Brew\"></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/marketing\"><span>Marketing Brew</span></a> is an email newsletter by The Morning Brew that focuses on marketing-related news and content. In this email footer, subscribers can easily edit their email preferences to specify how often they’d like to receive emails or unsubscribe altogether.</p> \n<h3>The Hustle</h3> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/jhg2kC4-IDXzYz6ONByuT4rNhVLi53WBxjGbVqEsfYLCFHT5kEhUHaNX_gXezWQhFbbCw-nc5S7_YetrBYmaqOPGmInd0nHf8izegd3RMNP55fjmx7CSwEy01FaaxQSmcpS05kYu=s0\" width=\"491\" height=\"394\" alt=\"Unsubscribe button example from The Hustle\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://thehustle.co/\"><span>The Hustle</span></a>, a HubSpot media company, has a daily tech and business newsletter where readers can offer real-time feedback about that day’s issue. The footer of each daily email has a cheeky unsubscribe button that’s easy to understand and may make the reader think twice before unsubscribing.</p> \n<h3>The Skimm</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/7Jy4ew-6ohtqX6fmPUnk-XSOJZ6iWhCvsY6Pwt6PK09gcoo-YdY3myPwek8nsSbv5iGwTJoBg3cBoTR3PklfmdjUZ-NWPoUEc0aLUkvn6iiDDfuwlDSoNPcTXqyXLNbZ0V6oUBG1=s0\" width=\"624\" height=\"245\" alt=\"Unsubscribe button example from The Skimm\"></p> \n<p>The Skimm has several variations of its popular newsletter. The <a href=\"https://www.theskimm.com/money\"><span>Skimm Money</span></a> newsletter has easy-to-understand language in the footer to empower readers to take control of their email preferences. Again, the reader could see they have subscription options that could better suit their needs which could prevent them from unsubscribing.</p> \n<h3>Lavendaire</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/EfNvUSTOLP_Fu-WGYA6RTTUa0HqZkMxpg1vjDCZLTGOf1OXehHWI8jV0VpQ2vXBmWQaPCjetFPPJ-MFU_ENBs_H78Q0owHnXrDxZ4iRihB1uDQxqTXzCkH45VDndKX3TffeqaJXs=s0\" width=\"624\" height=\"167\" alt=\"Unsubscribe button example from Lavendaire\"></p> \n<p>Self-care content and stationery company <a href=\"https://www.lavendaire.com/\"><span>Lavendaire</span></a> has a gentle message for those looking to unsubscribe, emphasizing the importance of having an engaged list.</p> \n<h3>HeyDay</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/Hyc5vlrvLgI9_Ft10RaBElEwy7Bzh5wX3HsFBD3hxTzBNw9BvFzrre-O_qopOeFOscjeP17B4m3eTPgf38IfXuMjr9E_pDybnsOR1-ibsdHEDPXpHVlCmjSWiCfjWQ-WFZudWb0W=s0\" width=\"624\" height=\"85\" alt=\"Unsubscribe button example from HeyDay\"></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.heydayskincare.com/\"><span>HeyDay</span></a>, a company that offers skincare services has an unsubscribe message that is incredibly on-brand, comparing clogged pores to full inboxes. This brand also provides a great example of giving readers the option to modify their subscription or unsubscribe completely.</p> \n<p>When it comes to email marketing, having users unsubscribe is a natural occurrence. By making the process as straightforward and simple as possible, you can create a better experience for your contacts and brand.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=6185e702-0cbb-4f65-84e0-ffc0f9b39f42&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call to action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6185e702-0cbb-4f65-84e0-ffc0f9b39f42.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Sep 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/400cd460-b98f-401b-a565-0dc8cd51719c.png","linkMd5":"b0c5921086c44a470425109c1557f225","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn24@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-789_98976e46f3c8a4b5.webp","destWidth":356,"destHeight":60,"sourceBytes":3770,"destBytes":5604,"author":"lalfred@hubspot.com (Lestraundra Alfred)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/400cd460-b98f-401b-a565-0dc8cd51719c.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn24@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-789_98976e46f3c8a4b5.webp","https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/RiJ4unTzXsoHNHP8zmqel_qijjNw4-rR3AqEYfyGax50pg6B5-I9CcOD-jMx9P9L41mATuOzX-tCbPFPkBgXXcsk96y6z0wwVHGkH3viPlwPAXk0mvtyq72G7UxbJxxMziCPyNNP=s0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn21@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-43-919_871c88a366d6dda1.webp","https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/jhg2kC4-IDXzYz6ONByuT4rNhVLi53WBxjGbVqEsfYLCFHT5kEhUHaNX_gXezWQhFbbCw-nc5S7_YetrBYmaqOPGmInd0nHf8izegd3RMNP55fjmx7CSwEy01FaaxQSmcpS05kYu=s0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn66@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-49-056_6b8179a6307940b4.webp","https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/7Jy4ew-6ohtqX6fmPUnk-XSOJZ6iWhCvsY6Pwt6PK09gcoo-YdY3myPwek8nsSbv5iGwTJoBg3cBoTR3PklfmdjUZ-NWPoUEc0aLUkvn6iiDDfuwlDSoNPcTXqyXLNbZ0V6oUBG1=s0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn91@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-46-447_7f9a80f8b749cae1.webp","https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/EfNvUSTOLP_Fu-WGYA6RTTUa0HqZkMxpg1vjDCZLTGOf1OXehHWI8jV0VpQ2vXBmWQaPCjetFPPJ-MFU_ENBs_H78Q0owHnXrDxZ4iRihB1uDQxqTXzCkH45VDndKX3TffeqaJXs=s0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn21@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-52-081_95f251e59b30afce.webp","https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/Hyc5vlrvLgI9_Ft10RaBElEwy7Bzh5wX3HsFBD3hxTzBNw9BvFzrre-O_qopOeFOscjeP17B4m3eTPgf38IfXuMjr9E_pDybnsOR1-ibsdHEDPXpHVlCmjSWiCfjWQ-WFZudWb0W=s0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn22@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-45-502_268241c3fbaf6aa3.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6185e702-0cbb-4f65-84e0-ffc0f9b39f42.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn73@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-49-071_76464a90b68e6619.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Funsubscribe-button-best-practices&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn2@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-48-348_f6e594a3682caf13.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761741252},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:41","title":"Can and Should You Advertise Your Brand on Discord?","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/discord-advertising","description":"<p>Emerging platforms provide a unique opportunity for marketers. While it’s important to try new things in your marketing, is it worth trying new things if the platform is still so new that you don’t know if you’ll find success? For example, the once dismissed TikTok is now a social media channel with immense value for all different kinds of businesses.</p> \n<p>Discord is now an emerging platform posing the same questions as TikTok once did. Many marketers are unsure how it works and whether it makes sense to leverage the tool as an experimental strategy.</p> \n<p>If you’re curious, this post will explain what Discord is, whether it makes sense to join the platform, and how to market your brand or business if you do.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Ad Campaign Planning Kit\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2>What is Discord?</h2> \n<p>Discord is a voice and chat platform where users join conversation servers, sometimes through exclusive invites, and talk to other members about niche topics. Initially launched in 2015 for gamers, it has since grown to house a diverse group of users, from influencers to content creators to businesses using the platform as an alternative to Slack and Microsoft Teams.</p> \n<p>Considering that it has experienced considerable growth and now caters to various groups, it makes sense that marketers may be curious about joining the platform and seeing if it can help them meet their marketing needs.</p> \n<h2>Can you advertise on Discord?</h2> \n<p>Yes, and no.</p> \n<p>There are no native advertising tools that you can find on other social media platforms like Facebook or TikTok, but you can still advertise your business organically through community engagement; “Brands can authentically engage with consumers on Discord by leveraging what is already appealing about Discord to consumers — forming relationships around common interests and having discussions in real-time,” <a href=\"https://www.marketingdive.com/news/how-discord-aids-brands-quest-to-engage-fans-around-emergent-culture/605168/?utm_source=Sailthru&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=Newsletter%20Weekly%20Roundup:%20Social%20Media%20Today%2008-21-2021&amp;utm_term=Social%20Media%20Today%20Weekender\">said</a>&nbsp;Jesse Nicely, VP and group strategy director at Cashmere Agency, to Marketing Dive.</p> \n<h3>Which brands should use Discord?</h3> \n<p>Most businesses can benefit from using Discord, but the benefits are significant for those looking to create an always-on, engaged community of like-minded people that are interested in what your business has to offer.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Kenny Layton, Discord’s Head of Talent Partnerships, <a href=\"https://edm.com/features/how-discord-gave-artists-a-platform-to-connect-with-purpose\">said</a>&nbsp;to EDM.com, “We like to call ourselves the 24-hour diner of the internet, where communities can just come and hang out with each other at any time they want.” While it is possible to create a community on other social channels, most people follow a wide variety of accounts, creators, brands, etc., but your Discord community is focused solely on your business.</p> \n<p>Brands that are interested in learning more about their audience should also consider using Discord; “A lot of the time with artists they’re always having to guess what the fans want or are thinking...there’s no better way to know what your fans want than to have them tell you. That can inform...marketing and advertising spend. That data is valuable,” <a href=\"https://edm.com/features/how-discord-gave-artists-a-platform-to-connect-with-purpose\">says</a>&nbsp;Brian Barnett to EDM.com.</p> \n<p>However, as mentioned above, it is an emerging platform. There are no specific tools for advertising your channel, but, again, it can help you create relationships with your audience, which is a driving factor of <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-loyalty?_ga=2.160256125.111883232.1630324730-1819533034.1630324730\">customer loyalty</a>.</p> \n<p>If you’re interested in leveraging the platform, let’s discuss the different ways you can promote your brand on Discord.</p> \n<h2>How to Promote Your Brand on Discord</h2> \n<h3>Build your own community.</h3> \n<p>The best way to promote your brand on Discord is to build a business-specific community server, along with different related channels for conversation. You can then invite users to join, have them find you organically through browsing the platform, or promote it on your other social channels and in marketing materials.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/mkbhd/featured\">Marques Brownlee</a>, a technology YouTuber, has a Discord community channel called the MKBHD. His community centers around discussions of his content, like podcasts and new videos, but he also created additional channels to promote different topics of conversation, as shown in the image below.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/brownleee%20discord%20sidebar.jpg?width=390&amp;name=brownleee%20discord%20sidebar.jpg\" alt=\"marques brownleee discord sidebar channels example\" width=\"390\" style=\"width: 390px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Music streaming service <a href=\"http://spotify.com\">Spotify</a>&nbsp;also has a Discord community that features the channel #listeningparty (shown in the image below). Active users can share links to playlists they’re currently listening to, and voice chat about the music. &nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/spotify%20listening%20party.jpg?width=566&amp;name=spotify%20listening%20party.jpg\" alt=\"spotify listening party discord server for listening party\" width=\"566\" style=\"width: 566px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Within your community, you can further promote your brand by sharing links to your external social profiles, as beauty brand Starface has done for their Twitter account in the image below.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/starface%20promoting%20twitter%20account.jpg?width=610&amp;name=starface%20promoting%20twitter%20account.jpg\" alt=\"starface promoting twitter account on discord\" width=\"610\" style=\"width: 610px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>In addition to advertising your business, you can also use Discord as a tool for customer service by creating specific channels to house answers to frequently asked questions, or where users can ask questions and get answers from you or other active community members.</p> \n<p>When you create a community, you can also set rules to ensure that everyone is respected and welcomed and designate moderators to patrol the channel to ensure rules get followed.</p> \n<h3>Join communities and servers relevant to your business offerings.</h3> \n<p>Another way to promote your business on Discord is to join other channels or servers relevant to your business and engage in conversations. Most channels are moderated, but you’ll likely be allowed to share links to your content, like high-quality blog posts that help you to draw in new users.</p> \n<h2>Can and Should You Advertise Your Brand on Discord?</h2> \n<p>Nicely <a href=\"https://www.marketingdive.com/news/how-discord-aids-brands-quest-to-engage-fans-around-emergent-culture/605168/?utm_source=Sailthru&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=Newsletter%20Weekly%20Roundup:%20Social%20Media%20Today%2008-21-2021&amp;utm_term=Social%20Media%20Today%20Weekender\">said</a>, \"Discord's fast-paced nature makes it fertile ground for emergent culture and trends, and allows brands the opportunity to constantly engage with consumers on interesting topics.\"</p> \n<p>While the platform doesn’t have the built-in advertising features on other channels, it can be extremely useful for marketers looking to build a community of like-minded users who enjoy your business and want to engage in conversation. However, as noted before, Discord is still an emerging platform for marketing, so it can be challenging to get your foot in the door or see immediate success.</p> \n<p>If you take the time to create a unique Discord community with different channels for conversation, engage with users in your community, and you provide them with high-quality content that they enjoy, you’ll likely find yourself with an active channel that teaches you more about your audience.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=46d72524-f4a7-44e9-9af0-935be9bb3891&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"advertising plan\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/46d72524-f4a7-44e9-9af0-935be9bb3891.png\"></a></p>  \n<img alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\"
